review_title: It was a good learning experience and a place to get a good "big company" foundation and perspective.
pros:
Big company with many locations, if you need/want to move somewhere it's possible to find work without leaving the company.
Good place to learn policies and live within a culture of best practices
cons: Upward movement is difficult and because of its size you are "sheltered" from the opportunity to see and participate in the bigger picture many times.  Difficult to advance as a high performer with no gray area in the HR policies and current movement to de-level many senior personnel.

review_title: Pay is good, management not so much.
pros: I can't complain about the pay, wages are set by the Area Wage Determination (AWD) which is determined by the federal government.  Hours worked were very flexible, although I believe this was due to my immediate manager, and not due to the company as a whole.
cons: Benefits are too expensive, even though AWD allocates an additional $3-something to pay for benefits, I was losing about 40% of my paycheck to insure my family of 3.  Information about what was going on was impossible to find, everything I heard was based on the local rumors.  Seemed like the company was only concerned about their overall profits.

job_title: Systems Engineer Principal in Reston, VA
pros: Great company benefits, people, locations, work life balance, vacation, career opportunities  and compensation, culture and values and reasonable company to work for if you do not have high expectations.
cons: Low increases in pay and promotions. You may not realize all of the discussions about having a work / life balance. Working proposals on the weekend and on holiday can be a bummer. Do not expect anything for it.

review_title: Engineering Planner for a Naval submarine program.
pros: Plenty of opportunities for training and getting face time with upper management. Gain operations, finance and engineering experience. Opportunities for independent projects and business trips to see actual engineering work.
cons: Sometimes the program structure would become far too rigid, but also the management structure and business rhythm changed far too often. Initiating 'change' was a large barrier at times (signature loops and battling the clock).

review_title: Great Career Starter, Lower Than Average Pay
pros: Gained great experience working with a talented group of analysts.  The business was very diverse as well, so it was a good experience to learn from.
cons: The pay was below average especially in the Sunnyvale, CA area.  I was required to work late and on some weekends throughout the year to meet management deliverables, which were at times, very redundant.

job_title: Information Assurance Engineer in Powder Springs, Optional[GA]
pros: The defense of our nation is at stake and this company addresses real defense needs for our country and many others with cutting edge technology. IO slept easier at night knowing how I was part of something good and much larger than myself.
cons: Any large corporation has a lot of moving parts and may not be easy to find your  organization structure.way around. LM was the largest company I had ever worked for and took a lot of effort to understand the ever changing organizational structure.

pros: Great experience with other interns and exposure to entire company. They work hard to bring all the interns at each location together about once a week for different things like upper management face to face or six-sigma training
cons: The company is so large it can be a pain to get things moving or be talking to the correct person. Every task has multiple ways to accomplish it and all of them will be filled with red tape

job_title: Senior International Trade Compliance Analyst in Orlando, FL
pros:
Decent Healthcare Benefits and pay. 
Good working environment
Working with best of class of people
Onsite medical office
Cafe onsite with good food
Good 401k
Good employee discount program
Great coworkers
cons: Management needs to offer more opportunities to work remote and promote from within. It takes much too long to move from one level to the next despite excellent performance reviews. I wish I would have negotiated for a higher salary when I took the job as I am currently doing the job or multiple people due to others moving to different positions and not being replaced.

pros: Good Pay, competitive benefits.  My experience: mostly agreeable, nice folks.
cons: Uncertainty of the defense industry and contracts combined with an unstable vision from leadership of how to deal with change creates an elevated atmosphere of anxiety.  Lots of second career retired military that assume higher management roles of which a significant percent lack engineering, modeling, procurement, finance backgrounds to ask the right questions that prevent programs from missing goals.  I've noticed their solution to cost and schedule variance has simply been to throw more people at problems where more people doesn't solve the problem.

job_title: HRIS Analyst in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Amazing culture with a deeply committed desire to improve and lead the world in products and services rendered. This is an exciting time to be a part of LMC
cons: Sheer size of the place, gps on my Fitbit proves I walk about 3 miles a day just from the parking lot to my office and to meetings.

job_title: Multi Functional Financial Analyst Asc in Orlando, FL
pros: The salary and benefits are excellent. Very competitive. My offer was 25% higher than the other offers I received as a college new hire. The employees are great to work with and the work is very meaningful.
cons: Slow promotion structure compared to many other companies. Rigid HR policy makes it difficult for high achievers to move quickly. Performance management not always handled well/indicative of actual performance.

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Brilliant talent.
cons: Poor Career Development and advancement in this department, will force advanced staff members to train junior staff members only to lay them off to save money, "to be more affordable", but in the end they spend more money because the new members have a huge learning curve.  The yearly layoffs in the name of "affordability" are a real moral killer.

review_title: Great Company to Advance New Technologies
pros: The company is very focused on solving the challenges our customer face and look to create innovative solutions to those problems.  The current application of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to many of these problems is exciting as many traditional approaches are being transformed.  It's very exciting to see the technologies get applied to these problems and the broad support from the leadership team to advance the state of these technologies across the many systems Lockheed Martin develops.
cons: IT infrastructure to enable virtual collaboration works but could be improved

review_title: One of the best defense contractors to work for
job_title: Senior Staff Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good salaries.  Decent benefits.  Interesting work.  Will pay overtime to salaried workers in certain circumstances.  Layoffs are rare.  When layoffs do occur, they are managed fairly and with significant advance notice.
cons: Promotions are rare for senior level and difficult.  You have to change positions to get promoted.  But, most internal positions are "wired".  Bonuses and cash awards are a joke.

job_title: Project Management and Planning Operations Representative in Denver, CO
pros: Great team, great management, great benefits, and Waterton is amazing.
cons:
There's a few people that have advanced and are absolutely terrible for the teams. Dealing with certain departments can be less than productive.

The biggest problem is the culture within management. Most work 60hrs plus and dont even think twice about expecting that of peers and subordinates.

review_title: Program Manager in Lockheed Health Division
pros: Lockheed is an established company with well defined processes and management practices. it offers a very advanced intranet where information is generally easy to find.
cons: Very rigid structure. For such a huge company they work offer the same job security and benefits of a tiny government contracting company. It is exatly like working for a very large placement agency. The company is also run like government, because the management is almost entirely from former government employees.

review_title: We never forget who we are working for, but we do forget who is working for us.
pros: Lockheed Martin is well respected as a result of the advanced products they sell, the complex programs developed, and the engineering expertise of the engineers.
cons: Requirements creep is not controlled, and when solutions become too expensive, Senior Management accepts contract cancellations without fighting for the jobs of the people affected.

pros:
Great benefits
Flexible hours
Overtime Pay (at least for few more months - overtime gate of 5 hours is coming up)
Great people
Interesting projects
Ability move from departments and projects
cons:
Average salary
Union shop (engineering union)
Promotions are too structured
Outrageous bureaucracy  
Management tolerates medeocrity due to union
>90% contracts are military based; hence, slow for change
Program management/Systems engineering focus (let other companies to do actual work)

job_title: Senior Intelligence Analyst in Ormond Beach, FL
pros: Good business ethics applied to leadership as well as the employee.  Huge emphasis on diversity, workplace safety, etc.  Very supportive of the individual employee and their health. Free health club bennie in addition to the normal benefits.
cons: When your contract ends, be ready to move to another city for a LM job or be ready for lay off if you can't.

review_title: Pros and Cons of Lockheed Martin Aero
pros: Good benefits and savings program.
cons: Poor environment - rare the office areas are cleaned. Communication is not up to par with other employers. Communication is still held close and not available to employees with the exception of news that has already gone to the public.

pros: I was living in Indianapolis and my manager was in Washington, DC who interviewed me over the phone and made sure I recieved all paperwork to bring me on board for a contract job in Hampton, Georgia.
cons: This was the first job in my life which I was paid the highest salary in my life on a weekly bais and I loved it.

review_title: Great Company, mediocre salary, poor benefits
pros:
Fantastic and intelligent people
Workforce development if you're in the right pipeline
Cutting edge tech
cons:
If not in the right development pipeline, you can be those"lifers"
Health benefits have gone from average to poor. One health plan available and you end playing quite a bit for it for so-so to poor coverage.
Salary is the bottom as far as defense contractors go. From a friend, "You won't get rich working here but you won't be poor either"
 Promotions are hard to come by.

review_title: Great co-workers, great work-life balance, very good pay.
job_title: Quality Engineer Staff in Fort Worth, TX
pros: My co-workers have been great. We get paid really quite well in comparison to others in my field.  The work-life balance is great.
cons: The health insurance is expensive for a family.  With government budget cuts, the company is in a cost cutting mode, which means that things such as outside training and conferences are pretty much a thing of the past.  It seems that the culture can be a bit too insular, whereby people here don't keep up with outside trends in their areas of expertise.

review_title: Interesting work; disappointing compensation.  A great place to learn and gain experience.
job_title: Mechanical Engineer in New Orleans, LA
pros: The work was very interesting and I gained a lot of valuable experience.  There are some amazing engineers there to learn from.
cons: The pay was below average and advancing has become very difficult since Michoud Operations has been merged into Lockheed Martin Space Systems.  The workload and overtime expectations were excessive at times (although some overtime is paid, even for salaried positions).

review_title: Excellent opportunities for growth and advancement are available with a company of this size.
job_title: IT Program Manager in Norfolk, VA
pros: Availability of self service job training, process library resources and mentoring opportunities are widely available if you actively pursue them.
cons: Big Lockheed moves slowly in some areas (i.e. recruiting, functional support, business development) after eliminating many indirect positions.

review_title: It has its ups and downs
pros: Work-life balance; 9x80 schedule (every other Friday off)
cons:
"Old school" management style and work ethic.
Not much autonomy for individual contributors - far too many layers of management.
Mediocre medical benefits - premiums have risen substantially in recent years, and actual coverage has declined (higher copays, annual deductibles, prescription costs, etc.). We are now paying more for less, and salaries are not increasing at a rate that compensates for the additional premium costs being flowed down to employees!
Speaking of compensation, in general, salaries are not competitive with other Silicon Valley companies.

pros:
Excellent pay and benefits
Competent workforce
A chance to work on  projects that will ultimately benefit U.S. service men and women
cons:
Bloated middle management 
Insanely stupid evaluation process- LM commits- majority of evaluation is graded by someone who knows little about what you do. Its really just a creative writing exercise.
Too reliant on US Government contracts in a period of sequestration.
Very political workplace- when times get tough you'd better have the right friends.

review_title: Lockheed Martin was a pretty good place to work for nearly 25 years
job_title: Senior Staff Software Engineer in Orlando, FL
pros: Lockheed had good medical, dental and insurance benefits. There was quite a variety of projects and technologies due to the large size of the company.
cons: Like most defense companies, they have been cutting expenses and that means asking employees to pay a bigger share of insurance costs. Although there are a large number of locations and opportunities, it's not always easy to move between companies and projects.

review_title: Very stable company with nice benefits
pros: Paid time off and flex-time benefits are great. Several leadership development programs available to high performers. Tuition reimbursement available. Paid weekly. Good work/life balance. Easy to move/re-locate within the company.
cons: Pay is almost always below the market average for the same job, and annual raises are usually less than 4%. Once you hit the average market salary for you job, you will not receive any additional raises (even if you are a high performer). You must be willing to relocate or change jobs to get a promotion.

pros: I traveled a lot which I loved, good benefits, cool projects
cons: Militaristic and sometimes stifling environment. White, middle aged men are by far the majority and they won't adopt any new ideas or technology. Can sometimes be misogynistic and I've seen rampant gender bias.

job_title: Senior Business Development in Centreville, VA
pros: Very well defined processes that have been proven for many years and that work, excellent with inclusion and diversity, great place to start your career as they promote from within. Resources are abundant, Everyone at LM is paid weekly (which is very nice) and their benefits are good.
cons: Not a great place to join mid-career or later as promotions are aimed at those who started their career at Lockheed. Trying to get any changes in processes, etc. is extremely difficult.

pros: Flexible work schedule. Decent Benefits. Decent pay. Overall a nice place to work and still have time for a family.
cons: A lot of overhead - very management heavy.  Pace of work is much slower than standard industry, though I expect that's dependent on which branch of LM you work for and who your managers are.  Very limited and very competitive opportunities for growth/promotion.

review_title: Neither the best nor the worst
job_title: Software Engineer, Senior in King of Prussia, PA
pros: You'll find interesting and unique opportunities that you aren't likely to find, especially in the King of Prussia area.  Paid time off is decent and the 401k plan is nice.
cons: Long term employment prospects often seem unstable.  The employment experience can vary greatly from group to group and manager to manager.  Education assistance and health benefits have reduced in quality over the year.

pros: This is a pretty good company to work for straight out of school. It may not be so as you transition into more mid level roles.
cons: The ability to rise is somewhat limited after the mid levels. There is an especially sharp focus on overhead and cutting back on any expenses, all the way down to how much paper you are printing.

pros: Huge defense contractor = offices in plenty of congressional districts.  There's probably one close to you.  This company is trying to catch up and shift its culture to meet 21st century needs.  It's getting there slowly, but it will get there before 2030.
cons: Expensive health insurance, no bonus structure for employees below Director level.  Hiring the best talent is very difficult with poor culture policies and below-average salaries

pros: Since the acquisition of Sikorsky from UTC to Lockheed Martin, the company has direction. Where UTC lacked in overly managed everything, Lockheed Martin has taken an analytical and problem solving approach. They don't just throw money around to make things go away, and I'm happy to see that change in the leadership of the company. Great communication to employees, and great employee benefits.
cons: You have to actually work hard to keep the company profitable. Many people do not understand this concept within the lines.

pros:
Great pay, benefits, and hours
Every other Friday off.  Good job overall.
cons:
Seniority rules
Older non productive employees get to keep their job while younger employees that work goes out the door. I wouldn't recommend this job for that reason. Too many layoffs.

job_title: Field Staff Engineer in Marietta, GA
pros: Great company, amazing technology and developments and if your into aviation this is one of the best.
cons: This position required extended world travel, which sounds great, but can be exhausting.  Additionally portions of the company are subject to "the good ol boy" club mentality which can be hard to be successful at.

pros:
Good Benefits 
Interesting Projects to Work On
Great stability in terms of employment
cons:
Stressful Environment 
Lack of Opportunity to Move Upward once you reach a certain level (level 4 is a parking garage for many good people at Lockheed)
Lateral movement within the company is very difficult

pros: Decent to good salary, looks good on resume
cons: Extremely political and advancement is directed to anyone under 40.  Human Resource Dept is ineffective and no one relies on them. Promotions are next to impossible unless you are on management favorite list.  The hiring process is 3 candidates must be interviewed and many times LM uses people as check the box candidates just so they hire the person they created the job for. Lockheed Martin will work you like a dog!!!

pros: Lockheed Martin tries to take care of it's employees. The benefits are good to great with plenty of vacation and time off.
cons: The cons have to do with there people management and contacts. We got caught up in a RIF because the contracts were not over lapping of or back to back. And rather than bridge us to the next contract, they decided to let us go.

job_title: Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Job is relevant, opportunity for experience is amazing, nice work culture.
cons: The initial start was being integrated right into all of the work that the team is currently on so its a bit much in the beginning but thats why the hire people who they feel a confident enough to contribute in any way they can and quickly learn what is going on.

job_title: Information Systems Security Risk Analyst, Staff in Palmdale, CA
pros:
Lots of locations to work at and the company encourages you to move around
Interesting work
Some programs offer flexible hours
Working with some of the smartest people in the world
cons:
They have to restructure their wage scale to fit the market every few years and it takes forever to catch up.
Management is focused on metrics but won't provide support or personnel needed to get work done properly
Lower than market wages means people don't want to hire in unless they are hired at a level they aren't qualified for

review_title: Great company and slow paced environment!
pros: Flexible schedule, great 401k, good holidays/PTO. The work environment is laid back and has a good life and work balance. The job positions are extremely flexible. The program is moving extremely fast, so very fast promotion. A lot of young employees, so great culture for young people.
cons: Because it is a defense contractor, everything has to go through bureaucracy and can delay work. If you are looking for a fast place, long hours, and high pay, you are likely better off somewhere else. High deductible health insurance and sub par salary.

pros: All workers are treated with respect, and learning is emphasized. I developed close relationships to my coworkers and upper management. Management is always looking for talent, and if you prove yourself as an intern they will offer you a full0time employment opportunity. Workplace is not very stressful for interns. You have to take initiative because you won't have set tasks from time to time.
cons: LMCO is a very big matrix organization, so communication from leadership to lower level employees is not efficient.

review_title: So so. Not great, not worse than elsewhere
pros: If you're not  a metal bender, it can be an uphill struggle, but keep your head down and you won't be bothered to much if you don't want to be.
cons: Just a number. Huge company and lots going on. Easy to get lost in the shuffle. I left for a better opportunity, but don't have bad feelings about Lockheed.

pros: This is a great company to work at, as long as you are not in a limited contract position. You can learn a lot and can be given more responsibility if making good progression in current role.
cons: The only downside I found with working for Lockheed was the limited contract term. If they had a onger contract, I would have definately stayed with them.

pros: The low level management was respectful most of the time and it allowed me the ability to get some experience on my resume.  Information sharing across the company was good.
cons: Appreciation from management was a minimum.  Salaries were excessively below industry standards and awards and bonuses that were promised were not delivered upon.

review_title: Great to work on such important projects for the nation.
pros: Many exciting projects to work on that are leading edge technology. The test labs I managed were among the top facilities in the world.
cons: With the merge with Martin, it always seems the work is leaving California. With the government spending cuts, LM has to cut it's workforce to keep in balance.

review_title: My overall experience with Lockheed Martin Information Systems & Global Services was positive.
pros: Some of the best reasons to work for Lockheed Martin Information Systems & Global Services are the quality people that I worked alongside, the ability to advance in your career, the ability to transfer to other jobs through a wide geographical area, and the overall compensation package.
cons: As a corporation, Lockheed Martina Information Systems & Global Services does not always promote based on merit.  It is very easy to get into a program or work site where favoritism and politics exist.

job_title: Cost Schedule Analyst in Lexington, KY
pros: You develop useful knowledge of contracting and your team does their best to help when you are in need.
cons: You may be thrown into learning your job without a lot of help at the beginning but it depends on which department and what the staff size is (as with most jobs).  You may have some trouble moving up the ladder but it shouldn't be too difficult after you put in your time.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Lovely location outside of Philadelphia.  Safe clean work environment.  Volleyball and tennis leagues.  Some exciting simulation and modeling work.  Tech refresh for some employees.  Union for engineers as protection against management.
cons: First level management is competent, useful, and helpful.  Second level management tends towards incompetence.  Don't know much about higher levels but assume they are just paper pushers.

review_title: Any career path or experience is available to you within the company.
pros: Benefits, exposure to interesting and cool programs, pay for performance is really rewarded. The benefits for things you don't always think about like relocation, time off, 401k, are very good.
cons: Big company red tape can get in the way. Getting your voice heard on issues is more challenging when the management chain is so big.

job_title: Materials Engineer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Lots of opportunities if you're in the right group.  Tons of training opportunities.  Good benefits.  Good discounts (cell, cars, misc purchases). Good starting vacation for new hires. Fully vested 401k (or at least was when I was there).  Usually saw a yearly pay increase.
cons: no longer offers a pension for non-union employes (I was near the end of them offering that).  Not all departments are great, but if you have talent, you can move out of a bad situation pretty easily.  Bonuses are rare.

review_title: kiss up and you can stay employed.
pros: none, used to be a great company to work for but now, i can't think of any pros of working there.
cons: caught in a downward spiral of quality and the effects of poor management decisions. Other companies more at a faster rate when it comes to newer technologies. To top heavy to be agile or nimble and to slow to make any significant changes.

job_title: Electronics Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: LM is a very stable company with a lot of interesting technologies.  The company generally has strong ethical culture and is committed to performing for the customer
cons: At a company this large it can be easy to get lost in the shuffle.  The company itself is aging rapidly which will be a challenge in the next few years.  The uncertainty of defense and other government contracts will be a interesting time for the company.

job_title: Aircraft Assembler in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good pay. A lot of opportunities  for a lot of different kinds of positions.  Tuition reimbursement. Every other Friday off for salaried people who do not work over time. A lot of work for a lot of engineers.
cons: Top down political culture that does not focus on productivity.  But if you are a politician that is not worried about productivity  that is a pro.

review_title: 27 years at LM - Times have changed
pros: Back in the Cold War days, we made *lots* of influencing products - Often very innovative,   highly integrated, and effective...
cons: At some point along the way, processes & profits became "more" important than the product - Not bad if your a shareholder but the product cutting edge

review_title: Great learning and growth opportunity for aerospace engineers.
pros:
Independence - opportunities to make decisions and take responsibility.
Growth - increasing levels of responsibility as desired. 
Technical - the work itself is challenging but meaningful.
Benefits - great medical, dental, life, and other insurance; 401k matching; events, etc.
Great pay
cons:
Management is often caught up in the political environment that comes with corporate structure. 
New ideas are often not appreciated or unheard.
A rating system that compares coworkers, often unjustly.
Can lay you off in a moments notice, regardless of whether you are doing great work or not (no time to prepare).

pros: Although many managers are old school, I have had incredibly flexible management which didn't get stuck on things that don't matter. Big campus have amenities (gym, Starbucks, clinic). We do really cool work. Good support for HR function, if you will move to DC the opportunities are endless.
cons: You have to relo to crappy locations to keep moving up. LM Commit (a joke), hierarchical, slow to change and those on the bottom are stuck with the tactical work.  The medical benefits are expensive!

review_title: MIssion-focused, great mission, value their engineers and veterans, tops in ethics.
pros:
Highly mIssion-focused organization, for a great mission -- defending our country.

The company knows very well that they are an engineering company. So, they look after and appreciate their engineers.  Also great with & for veterans. 

Tops in ethics.  Excellent culture. Excellent people to work with, and work for.
cons: Starting salaries tend to the low side, salary growth tends to be slow. (Salary process has become fairly transparent.)  Training budget always tiny. (Beginning to do more in employee training with innovative approaches.)

job_title: Deputy Task Order Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Lockheed Martin is an industry leader who values their employees ideas and innovation.
cons: In Oklahoma City, there isn't a large representation of Lockheed employees so it is harder to get a job and also promotions in this area.  If you are willing to relocate it makes it easier.

review_title: It's a big company with a big company feel.
job_title: Intelligence Analyst in Crystal City, Optional[VA]
pros: Lots of job opportunities and chances for upward mobility. They're also very diversified and have locations all around the world.
cons: The healthcare benefits are subpar compared to other companies. Employees typically shoulder 25% of the cost of their healthcare plans, which is a lot when compared to just over 10% at other leading competetors. However, if this is what is necessary in order to pay people better wages, I guess it's a fair trade.

job_title: Satellite Communications Engineer in Chantilly, VA
pros: neat projects; worked on a number of neat projects for a great customer
cons: The company won't even provide free coffee.  Management offered no raises due to the bad economy yet were redoing the VPs office as the previous VPs office wasn't nice enough for him.  If people on a project are under performing they will add resources therefore spending money and will cut others positions who weren't underperforming to pay for fixing the other underperforming part of the project.

review_title: 30 yr continuous employment with LM has been a good overall experience. Tough the last several yrs with cuts.
job_title: IT Program Manager in Rockville, MD
pros: Good senior management thinking long-term growth and over financial performance of the company.  Benefits are not as good as they once where as the company reduces costs.
cons: Outlook and opportunities for long-term employees are there but very limited as there is a move to promote and over challenging opportunities to younger employees.

review_title: Good company, but little opportunity to earn a promotion for newer employees
job_title: Reliability Engineer Asc in Grand Prairie, TX
pros: Good reputation, fairly competitive pay, largest defense contractor, multiple locations and programs
cons: Promotions are based on time, not merit. Once you're acclimated to your job, you are unlikely to move unless a contract ends or is lost, even if you're not doing the job they originally told you that you would be doing.

pros: Great company in general. This company is a big contributor to our nations defense. Great people to work with as well.
cons: Not a lot of support from upper management with career advancement. If you don't come in at a great salary level, you will not likely be happy with your pay no matter how many 3% annual increases you receive. Yes only 3% if you do everything right. Promotions come maybe every 5 yrs.

pros: Opportunities for skill development through training, encouraged to network, friendly people, and they seem to be fair when it comes to replacement. Weekly pay.
cons: The pay is pretty low, and the benefits can use some work. I'm told regularly that I should start looking elsewhere because I won't get the treatment I deserve here. It's a large company, and it can be hard to move up from the bottom.

pros: Local management truly cares and helps you achieve work related goals. Excellent sick leave plan.
cons: Company is selling off our piece and has given smaller raises to the organization versus the rest of the company because they know the deal will close soon. They have transitioned to a terrible health plan option and in order to maintain the better plan, the cost increased by 66%. They also are phasing out pension plan benefits and years of service that count toward it.

pros: If you're part of the good ol' boys/girls club, you'll fit right in.
cons: Upper level management can be blind to the complaints/issues of line management because they don't talk to the staff under the line manager about staff issues/concerns.  Line management takes credit for work that their staff completed.  And internal positions are often filled by line managers selecting their friends for open positions instead of posting the job internally.

review_title: Worst employee experience ever. Over committed on potential for growth and under delivered.
job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Still not sure. Oh yeah, 9/80 schedule. One less day every two weeks you have to tolerate the cancer that is Lockheed Martin.
cons: The culture is toxic. Talent is synonymous with seniority and who you know. Promotions to executive level require retirement or mortality and after you work with these people you start to wish for the mortality path. Significant tolerance for passive aggressive and back stabbing behavior. Conflict is avoided and supplemented with gossip. If you are a high pot at your current employer stay away from this company.

review_title: Administrative Assistant, chief clerk, team captain
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Getting to work with others. Share knowledge learned in meetings and presentations. Earn respect for accomplishments from others.
cons: My department was all based on management, and a lot of hard working people. Not always receiving credit for accomplishments made. Not rated individually as should have been.

pros: There are lots of opportunities for growth, challenging work, and there are many ways to expand your career skill sets.
cons: There are so many employees that even star performers are treated like numbers and not people. There are advocates for the program you might work for, but there are not advocates for the workers themselves. It is kind of like selling your soul to the company.

pros: All of this depends on what group that you are in. One can have a lot of time off and there a lot of benefits that the company offers.
cons: I had the misfortune of working in a group that was one hundred percent horrible. Management was unprofessional and would make life harder than it needed to be just because they could. The value of an employee is based on butt kissing vs on the quality of work.

review_title: Overall a good place to work!
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Huntsville, AL
pros: I had a positive experience working here. RMS has the most interesting work of the four companies. If you're willing to move, you could feasibly work most anywhere in the US or abroad. Great opportunities for networking with other engineers via social or volunteer activities. Very inclusive workplace.
cons: Typical mega-corporation pitfalls. We lost unlimited sick leave this year which made life VERY stressful for working parents and people just show up to work sick or still contagious. Defense work comes and goes so there's a lot of churn and uncertainty.

pros: You have the opportunity to work on great projects if your leader supports you.  Access to resources to support your work for the company and professional development.
cons: Toxic work environment.  Many employees long term employees who exhibit toxic behaviors that have been allowed.  The corporate HQ is rampant with insider/outsider dynamics.  Low tolerance for new ideas from employees who are hired externally.  The "that's not how we do things here" mentality which stunts growth, specifically in HR.  Also, the change in benefits was a large reason for my departure.

review_title: Lockheed Martin Corporation Profiting Off Retirees' insurance Premiums
pros:
(1)Job security re. not outsourcing outside U.S.,
(2) pay, 
(3)Unionized,
(4) Benefits as active employee
cons:
(1) Unequal treatment of salaried retirees vs. represented retirees under 65 insurance premiums
(2) A 30+yr, represented retirees 2009 HMO monthly insurance premiums for Kaiser Permanente-$551, Aetna-$993,
 Cigna-$1370, BCBS-$1647 vs salaried retiree BCBS-$610
(3) Represented retirees monthly insurance premiums in 2001 Cigna-$54, BCBS-$93,
(4) 2437% increase Cigna in 8 yrs, 1671% increase BCBS in 8 years
(5) Federal govt. reimburses LM what they pay for benefits via "allowable expenses"

review_title: Get your 5 years of experience and find an exit strategy.
job_title: Systems Integration and Test Engineer Senior in King of Prussia, PA
pros: Decent Pay, relaxed hours, life work balance
cons: This is not a company for career growth.  Get your 5 years of experience and find an exit strategy.  Functional Management's main goal is to keep labor cost low.

pros:
Starting salary
"Coolness factor"
Opportunities are there
cons: Opportunities may be there but be prepared to work overtime for them. Some programs require 45+hrs per week already, which you get little recognition for. It is best to find a program where you are slightly underworked and have the opportunity to take on extra projects. If you wind up on a busy program you will get no more credit than the next guy, but you are still expected to do all of the extras.

pros: Outstanding company, high level of ethics and integrity.  Good focus on employee professional development.  Generally very flexible in meeting needs for flexible work schedule.
cons: Demanding environment with nothing less than the best required.  Conscientious employees find themselves struggling to manage a good work / life balance.  Recent downsizing has made the environment tenable in some cases.

review_title: Overall a strong company to work for
job_title: Systems Engineer Senior in Havant, England
pros: Very ethical, diverse company.  Lots of depth in some areas (i.e. key programmes / products).  Well understood structure, plenty of room for movement.
cons: Very deep hierarchy, can be at risk of being pigeon-holed and therefore remove ability to move between roles.  Very process heavy.

review_title: Very positive work experience, lots of learning opportunity, fascinating products to work on, very important mission
pros: Excellent benefits and management support for getting an advanced degree, including tuition re-imbursement; great people to work with at all levels, pleasant work environment, lots of opportunities to learn through formal classes and on the job; strong finanacials, very solid company
cons: Large company momentum sometimes difficult to overcome when making changes; assignments sometimes given with little regard to relevancy of employee skills

review_title: Overall an excellent company to work for.
job_title: Senior Network Engineer in King of Prussia, PA
pros: Pros include competitive salary, outstanding work/life balance, very flexible scheduling options, exposure to many different technologies and tons of opportunity to expand skill set.
cons: Benefits options and costs are horrendous. When I started with the company about a decade ago the benefits were competitive and have since dropped off a cliff. I'm on my wife's benefit plans. LM does not spend enough on training for employees compared to other defense contractor competitors. Depending on the program/customer the work may seem slow and overly process    driven.

review_title: Many interesting opportunities, pay not so great
pros: Many unique projects, not impossibly hard to move across the corporation
cons: Pay will never be close enough to what other companies will offer

job_title: Multi Functional Financial Analyst in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Every other Friday off is nice.
cons: The pay is horrible. They expect you to work weekends and off Fridays for month end for no additional compensation. The pay is way too low. Takes forever to move up. Pay is a joke. No windows in the building, so its a very depressing environment. Have I mentioned the ridiculously low pay? The only way to get a higher raise is to compete against your fellow coworkers, so you don't really want to help eachother because you need to try to look better than everyone else. There is a stab eachother in the back mentality that makes teamwork hard. The work is repetitive and boring. A monkey could be trained to do it.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Owego, NY
pros: Large company typically meaning there is 'some' work available. Good benefits, flexible time. Good emphasis on ethics, safety.
cons: Easy to get lost and there are fewer and fewer higher positions. Managers make up majority of your work experience (mine is great, but can be so-so). Things happen slowly due to all the processes, and the regular employees have little say once something has been mandated.

review_title: Very interesting work, difficult to move up
pros: They do their best to treat the employee with respect, and provide interesting projects. A very large company with locations across the U.S., so opportunities to move are plentiful. Excellent leadership development program.
cons: A defense contractor in this economy makes it hard to get decent raises and/or get promoted. Lots of layoffs in the last 3 years. Although the company was very "top heavy", the layoffs are correcting that issue but that also means less higher level positions for those trying to move up.

review_title: great job for those who don't have career aspirations
pros:
very very smart, interesting people
ethical environment, do what's right attitude
low stress, flexible environment
engaging work, rocket science, robots, space, etc
good management
cons:
no career opportunities. no career path
experience very much depends on your business unit / manager
pay is average to low
lots of layoffs as of late (30K people?)

pros: Good benefits, decent salary, and OK job security.  Recognized name.  Established processes and clearly-defined hierarchy.  Corporate vision is clearly defined. Stable.
cons: Large corporation that can get bogged down with processes/procedures and cannot react in an agile fashion.  Seniority with the company is often rewarded over merit.  Easy to get lost in overall org.  Lots of layers of management.

job_title: Systems Integration and Test Engineer Senior in Goodyear, AZ
pros: Pay is above average for the area, however management has always had problems with middle managers staying the course and managing the staff correctly. I've had 7 middle managers in the 5 yrs that I have been here.
cons: Challenges of working here is the travel time required. It's advertised as a percentage in the job req but it's pretty much on demand. If there is a need, then you mudt go. To much time away from family for business travel made it hard to continue.

review_title: Company preaches Quality of Life (QOL), but workload prohibits meaning QOL.  Completely undermanned for the contract.
job_title: Program Management Associate Manager in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Co workers and 1st and 2nd level management.  This was the most can do group of people I've ever had the pleasure of working with.
cons: Our contract was completely undermanned.  Additionally, the contract bid was completely underbid.  There were many very, very good people that worked many, many long hard hours trying to get this work done.  It was very frustrating.

pros: Work at a GSU of Lockheed in Texas. Great management support within the program. Management lets you do your job with little interference as long as the customer is happy and operations are compliant with the government and its contract.
cons: Military biased company. Former enlisted military members stand little chance of upward mobility even if their education and experience is the same.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Work Life Balance has good days and bad days. Depending on your team it can be good.  Good benefit packages.  401K matching is good.  Plenty of areas to grow.
cons: Too much bureaucracy.  Hard to gain technical experience as a young employee when half your work is merely to satisfy process.  Get in a bad group, you will be miserable.  Culture encourages mid-level leadership to hide failures because help provided is too much.

pros:
Will be a great resume booster for future jobs
You learn a lot
If you know what you're doing you'll be taken seriously
cons:
Those who don't work hard always get rewarded
Lower pay than other defense companies
Expected to work all the time
There's a lot of older people working in the company which makes it hard for college graduates to feel comfortable and be taken seriously

pros: I feel valued as an employee and am well compensated.  Management offers plenty of growth opportunities and is flexible with work schedules
cons: Location is isolated which means there aren't many place to go for lunch.  On site cafeteria is terrible, so I always just bring my lunch but I would prefer to have someplace I can go for a real lunch break.

job_title: Site Supervisor and Senior Systems Administrator in Reisterstown, MD
pros: Been in service since 2011 and employment bridged from 2006. Very good HR and communication to me always. Love the company and would not change a thing at the present time.
cons: Sometimes the big picture gets skewed but that is with any company of that size. HR and Management is always there to listen to the employees when anything is needed.

job_title: Systems Engineer Staff in Gulfport, MS
pros: Lockheed offers very good training program for managers and addition coursework is available through the skillsoft web application. Overall the company maintains an ethical work environmemt.
cons: If you are not working at one of the enterprise locations you are pretty much treated as a second class citizen. Additionally, enterprise applications were not compatible with the customers systems which created extra work

review_title: Good place to build a career
pros: Strong ethical culture.  Good training, development, and mentoring opportunities.  Good ability to rotate between assignments and gain tremendously diverse experience.  Good benefits.
cons: Platform focused company, so you want to be in a platform focused part of the business.  Strong rich process set, which can at times means he business struggles to be nimble.

job_title: Missile Mechanic in Kings Bay, GA
pros: Very competitive benefits and schedule. Diverse workforce in a small community. Ballistic missiles are contracted well past my working years. Even if it were shut down today, there would be a decade of more work in decom.
cons: No comment yet. I have plenty to say, but I still work for Lockheed. It would be a guarantee that someone with pull would read this, take exception, and hold it against me in a manner that could be hidden from company policy.

job_title: Subcontract Administrator Associate in Marietta, GA
pros: Large responsibilities early on in career, tons of opportunity throughout LM, most members of team are willing to help at any given time
cons: Level 3s and 4s are not carrying weight, level 1s and 2s are overloaded without the benefits ($$), hard to advance due to stringent HR requirements

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Cape Canaveral, FL
pros: Good company to work for with great benefits and PTO. Salary was excellent for the location that I worked (cape Canaveral). Management was good except...
cons: My only complaint was that much of the work I did could have been done from home to save me a long drive to work but upper management seemed to have a phobia about employees not being seen at the office. The times I was able to work from home I got much more done.

pros: Great benefits and tuition reimbursement program. Challenging work and opportunity to grow within the company. Managers in my line never held me back.
cons: They demand a lot out of you, 40+ hour weeks are normal. Sometimes there is so much paperwork and BS that the end product really gets delayed or just forgotten about. Merit increases were meager at best, and the way they calculate salary raises are kind of silly. The pay scale can sometimes be misleading as well.

pros: Lockheed Martin Aeronautics has proven to me they care about your employment there. They listen to all inputs and try to find solutions that work for all.
cons: Lockheed Martin Space management needs to understand employee diversity. They want to only hire from a narrow group of individuals unless they can’t get anyone to apply. Then they will reach out.

job_title: Software Engineer Staff in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Fair Pay, Decent Benefits, Lots of different things to work on.
cons: Advancement opportunities go way down at mid level, ends up forcing older workers out. Leadership does not follow its own initiatives. Full Spectrum Leadership is how lower level employees are measured, yet senior and executive leaders do not follow it and even go the opposite. Large company, even great work can go unrecognized. Not enough bonus money to reward good work, only a handful of favorites garner incentive pay.

review_title: Job quality depends on the project and the environment you are in
job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
1. Jobs with meaningful purpose
2. Encourage higher career advancement (higher education, training, etc)
cons:
1. Job can be grueling and boring, depending on your current jobs/tasks
2. Work culture can be old-style, rigid, not encouraging to younger engineers.  This also depends on your current jobs/tasks.

review_title: Get your clearance and get out.
pros:
1) A lot of time off.
2) No work related stress what so ever.
3) If your in school this is the perfect job to have since out of an 8hr work day you really only have 40 min of true work.
4) get paid to surf the internet.
5) As soon as I'm done with school or a better oppurtunity I'm out.
cons:
1) No stress what so ever so after 1 day alittle stress would be welcomed since you can only surf the internt so long.
2) No room for growth if your interested in security.
3) Low pay but what can you expext with a job were all you do is sit and watch movies online.

review_title: Pluses and minuses; good for a large corporation
pros: Good work life balance.  A fair amount of vacation and you can usually take time off when you want.  People are pretty good as well.
cons: Promotions are a pain to come by... it's a bit hard to get a promotion.  Have to put in your time, and then management has to decide you're already working at that level.

review_title: Lockheed Martin is a great place to work if you put the effort in
pros:
- Great Benefits (like all companies these are changing)
- High Ethical Standards
- The work helps support U.S. Servicemen and Women
- Great leadership at the very top
cons:
- Big Corporation can make you feel like a number
- Very demanding workloads can add stress to work week
- Schedules vary in regards to vacation and holidays

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Littleton, CO
pros: Work life balance policies , vac time, experience, ability to work from home is only thing keeping me here even though they are forcing mandatory unpaid overtime
cons:
Unrealistic management driven deadlines.  Constant downsizing without decrease in workload
Promotions are a battle even though your work is a level above. Unpaid overtime that is mandated.

review_title: Opportunity to move around in the company, flexible schedule, but years of experience outweigh all else for promotions
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in King of Prussia, PA
pros:
- matching 401k: they match 50% of the first 8% you contribute
- flexible schedule, work from home may be available (but it's getting more difficult to get approved)
- usually okay with 40.0 hours/week
cons: It doesn't matter how good you are as a developer - years of experience are HEAVILY weighted. Talented 25 year olds can out-code a developer making twice their salary

review_title: Most interesting civilian job of my lifetime, we provide a wide range of support to a diverse group of professional.
job_title: Senior Physical Security Representative in Aurora, CO
pros: Outstanding people focused on excellence, the members of this team are engaged and determined to do the job well.
cons: Work location is 21 miles from my front door, The traffic in the Denver area has become a negative for me.

review_title: Company that is a reflection of its main customer, the U.S. government
pros: Moving away from male dominated old school management.   (Though it took a scandal to remove and replace previous CEO.)
cons: History of "good old boy management" to be changed. (Not unlike U.S. government.)  Now moving towards new "good old gal network".  Still not a company focused on being truly diverse.

review_title: An energizing culture with great teams of people.
pros: Lots of opportunity to learn and gain many skills that are valuable in the industry. The teams of people are some of the brightest that you'll encounter and very productive. Compensation is competitive, and benefits are spectacular.
cons: Depending on the program that you are on, there are limited opportunities to grow. Most programs are on government contracts, so you will be required to work with slower-paced and less adept government workers.

review_title: I had twelve years with some highs and lows, but I feel it was better than many companies their size.
job_title: Technical Operations Manager in Greenbelt, MD
pros: Huge company, jobs everywhere if you looked, would reward people to stay
cons: HR was pretty poor (missed sending a letter for life insurance), there was no work/home balance. I had a 98 hour work week once with no overtime or bonus.

review_title: Former Systems Analyst, Systems Integrator and Engineering Manager
pros: Great experience to grow and move about. Nice diversity and opportunity to work with people of all ages and backgrounds.
cons: The best talent does not stay long. Experienced professionals come from other competitors and not from within the company.  Training for employees is not as frequent or available as before.

job_title: Cyber Security Analyst in Washington, DC
pros: Great company with opportunities to grow. Excellent benefits. I spent 7 years with the company on several projects and was always lucky to work with exceptional managers who looked out for their employees. Assisted where necessary but gave the room to lead.
cons: No downsides with the company but maybe the clients who at times were extremely demanding but really not much different from my current situation.

pros: Multiple programs in the DC area. Generally you are able to jump between programs within the same division of the company. Interesting and challenging work. Mentors are available.
cons: Program is very customer focused, which is a good thing, until you realize your boss at LM doesn't know what you do. This program is more of a mgmt consulting type role. Interesting work but unless you have a highly visible position you could fall btwn the cracks.

job_title: Software Engineering Manager, Senior in Washington, DC
pros: Acceptable work life balance.  Management very focused on Diversity and Inclusion. Great opportunity to lean to good management skills. Great opportunity to learn to be a leader.  Leadership does not equal management
cons: Depending on the program you are on, training opportunities are very limited.  The current focus on cyst cutting aka affordability is killing the division. Uncertainty surrounding the strategic review aka spin off or sake of division

pros: Excellent benefits - good medical, dental & vision plans as well as a 401k and stocks
cons: Frequent layoffs of hourly employees - some layoffs of salaried, but limited

pros: Lockheed Martin offered a great benefits package including health and dental insurance.  My team mates and leaders were incredibly skilled and very helpful and supportive.  I also loved the analytical and technical aspects of my job.
cons: My salary started off below the national average for my position.  There was also intense competition and I never felt that my job was secure.

review_title: Lockheed Martin is not for everyone
pros: Staff are really smart and dedicated to the mission of the company.  Manager level and below employees are very willing to work across functions and share information. They are willing to go the extra mile.
cons: The leadership (director and above) does not seem to understand how to motivate and engage their employees.  HR does not listen to the business concerns, but rather believes they know best.  The HR function seems to always want to control the message and not let the business functions lead the charge.

review_title: Career opportunities, top company to work for
pros: Global network, innovative products, competitive pay, annual bonus structure, top-tier leadership development programs at all levels, abundance of internal training and development courses, reasonable work/life balance now with 9/80 off Fridays.
cons: Common challenges with large corporate companies: Heavy dependence on levels (workforce tiers), takes time to feel adequately compensated (typically Senior Analyst), bureaucracy, multiple layers of management may lead to decision by consensus, extremely structure, and reliance on Corporate policies and procedures.

pros: it was a job that paid money and benefits.
cons: no room for advancement, its like working in a retierment home, not many happy people in the lower levels, they talk about ethics but its all BS, managment hides in there offices and doesnt interact with workers much, no real incentive to stay, worse than space x, if you have any ambition to be more stay away from LM you wont go anywhere there your better of elsewhere.

job_title: Engineer in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: The Fury program was interesting/challenging.  The small engineering team was exceptionally talented and motivated to succeed.  San Luis Obispo is an unusually nice place to live and work for a large engineering company.
cons: Nearly Impossible to succeed with LM (Owego NY) oversight. Managed by old school fear & intimidation and failed to trust anyone in California as they weren't trustworthy themselves! Unfortunately, upper management proved to be really be exempt from following the LM core values the company promotes.

pros: 9x80 work schedule provides 20+ Friday’s off a year.  Pay is a little better than smaller defense contractors. Large corporation with lots of job opportunities. 401k is good.
cons: Health insurance is the worst I have had.  Family of 5 cost me $10,000+ out of pocket last year.  Yearly pay raises avg 2%. Can take a long time to increase your salary so you have to change jobs often if you want to increase your salary

review_title: World's largest A&D player but can be slow and bureaucratic internally.
pros: Flexible and consistently level number of work hours per week. Best reputation and sales leader amongst the A&D firms.
cons: Pay is not competitive with other firms. Culture tends to lean toward seniority versus a meritocracy; promotions can be political. Lethargic culture within some departments and lacks enthusiasm or innovation of other hi-tech companies.

pros:
Pleasant co workers
Casual workplace
The ability to tele commute from home or another LM location
Access to software is good
cons:
Lack of communication to developers (both salaried and contractors) 
-employees would be down-sized on very short notice--people would always be on edge
-key people (both developers and management) would be moved elsewhere and not replaced 
Management would oversell--targeted milestones would be pushed to later releases, this became quite common
Compensation on the salaried developer side was a lower than the average for the DC area

job_title: Embedded Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
-Very interesting projects that make a difference for our military
-Flexibile schedule
-Nice locations and facilities
-Easy to relocate to new places and new positions within the company
cons:
-Very large company so you may find yourself doing a small part on a big project, thus not able to see the whole development lifecycle of your project
-Government involvement means a lot of paperwork and procedure
-Defense contractor means no bonuses

job_title: Software Engineer Associate in Houston, TX
pros:
Fair compensation and they were willing to relocate me.
Easy to move to other places within the company in other parts of the country.
cons: My biggest complaint here was the yearly review and trying to talk to HR.  If you're not satisfied with your yearly review and don't get a satisfactory explanation for it, don't look to HR for any help.

review_title: It was a good company but there were a lot of inefficiencies
pros: They respect / are good at great work-life balance.  There is good opportunity for advancement.  There is a laid-back culture that makes it easy to relate to management.
cons: There are a lot of inefficiencies at the company.  Because it is a large company, there is duplication with departments and it is easy to get lost in the crowd.

pros: Seemed to be a stable company without any need to worry about tomorrow. Provides the opportunity to grow as a manager if you join the so called ELTP program.
cons: Very limited opportunity to grow as a professional due to the nature of products and customers. Practically, having a software development job there implies loosing a competitiveness at the job market. Too much formalism in the process of evaluating individual contributors.

review_title: Fantastic and Interesting Place to Work - Enjoy Working here
pros: Flexible work hours, as long as you do your work and work the 40 hours a week you are required to work there are no issues. Great employees to work with, all very smart. Challenging work.
cons: Constant layoffs every year for the past 4 years, due to federal government budget cuts.

review_title: Great place to start a career.
pros:
Their Engineering Leadership Development Program is one of the best technical development programs in the defense industry.

Good benefits.

Locations across the United States.
cons:
You have to know the right people in order to grow in your career.

You can easily become pigeon-holed into a singe role.

Programs are risk averse when it comes to using newer technology; as a result, you may not always get to utilize latest technologies in your work.

review_title: Diminishing work, lack of business hurting this division
job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Flexible work environment. Good benefits.Like to see more options to chose healthcare.
cons: Buddy system. If the PMOs do not like you if give it straight they will gang up on you to eventually get rid of you. Lots of nepotism. People who talk the talk but can not walk the walk running proposals and losing badly. Forced to take  LM medical insurance which is more expensive and express scripts prescription are the worst.

review_title: Great company that values diversity and builds cool stuff
pros: There is wide range of ethnic group in the work place and the distribution is well balanced. You'll get recognized and have room to grow if you have good skillset. The products are typically one-of-a-kind and of high value. You feel you are building something special that's hard to match in the commercial consumer product industry.
cons: Pay is not as good as other big name high tech companies.

review_title: Great company great benefits - but risky
job_title: Systems Engineer Staff in Portland, OR
pros: Great opportunities for salary, training, travel - flexibility in work location, family time is encouraged. 401k match and salary (including yearly increases and spot awards) are plentiful.
cons: As with any contractor, the possibility for contract loss is always in the back of your mind. You have to be prepared to duck and move, keep your resume' updated, it'll come in handy.

pros: All the benefits of working for a big company like training opportunity, lots of locations if you're willing to move, plenty to do if you want to try something new.  Very good flexibility (everyone gets a laptop and full flex hour control).  Pretty good school reimbursement program given most companies are eliminating this now.
cons: As with any big company the bureaucracy is insane.  Also take into account the customer (military) so in most cases LM ends up mirroring that type of infrastructure.

review_title: Best Company I Ever Worked For
pros: Cutting edge interesting work, great co-workers and management. Family friendly, OT when you want. Flexible hours. A company that you feel proud to work for, will try and keep you employed for as long as possible during government budget cuts.
cons: LMCO's industry is sensitive to defense cuts so layoff rumors are always present so job security isn't great but then again it isn't great anywhere these days.

pros: Variety of programs, tools, and domains.  A lot of affinity groups and friendly peers.  Great for developing skills and interests.
cons: Weak pay.  Excessive management and "leadership" positions.  Poor communication between functional managers.  Poor tool and process adoption and implementation.  Unpaid overtime work somewhat mandatory.

pros: Wide variety of jobs to internally apply to and across a diverse range of business areas and geographic locations. If you are an engineer looking to join a top engineering company, finding another with this skill set can be tough to beat.
cons: Management is inconsistent with enforcing their own policies. Some managers are real leaders forging the way. While others can barely manage themselves let alone their employees, at the expense of losing experienced talent.

pros: Great mobility.  Decent pay and benefits. Lots of locations.  Smart people.  Solid experience.  Great company to have on the resume.
cons:
I worked for both the MST and IS&GS business units.  The main complaint I had is the businesses were constantly being reorganized.  People became less motivated and raises started becoming a joke.

Promotions a lot of the time were political rather than merit.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Huntsville, AL
pros: The flexible work schedule is nice. If I have something personal that I need to take care of, chances are I can flex my time. The ability to earn overtime. some companies salary positions offer no compensation for over time, the current job I have pays straight time when hours exceed 45 weekly.
cons: Often times scope and schedule are very very demanding. Management tends to promise the impossible, even if you warned them that what they promised in the amount of time it is promised is not feasable.

job_title: Computer Systems Architect Senior in Orlando, FL
pros: Overall, Lockheed Martin is a good company. The work was interesting and there is opportunity to work with several different technologies. The company provides good benefits and opportunities for professional development.
cons: In Orlando, Lockheed Martin was one of the largest employers. Therefore, there is not a lot of incentive to pay above market rates. The salaries are on par with the competition, but not above the market so you will likely make the average salary for your position with LM.

pros: I worked on meaningful projects that have significant real world impacts.  The engineers I worked with were smart and talented.  There were opportunities for career advancement.
cons: This don't really count as a con in my book because it is just a different culture, but I have to write something.  Some of the benefits found in commercial software companies like stocked fridges, snacks, and happy hour Fridays don't exist here.

pros: Great hours, and a beautiful campus.  The job I do helps people.  Good leadership.  Competent coworkers, Extraordinarily competent coworkers.  And driven!
cons: Stuffy.  Folks seem pretty "face down" in their work.  I often feel like I'm making marketing marital rather than engineering real solutions.  This is a Hardware Company, period.  Software is second fiddle if a consideration at all.

pros:
-Very friendly coworkers, supervisors and bosses are very supportive and encouraging
-Living stipend
-Good trainings and intern events
-They literally say that if you got accepted as an intern they want you full time when you graduate
-It's fun to walk past impressive fighter jets every day on your way to your office.
cons:
-Perhaps due to the fact that LM is a government contractor things happen really slowly
-For me personally DoD wasn't a good fit
-Being inside in a cubicle by yourself all day can be draining

pros: Great company benefits - Health insurance, 401k, 3 weeks paid vacation with an extra week off (paid) between Christmas and New Year. Corporate environment is healthy with zero tolerance policies for retaliation and inappropriate behavior. The people I work with act and treat each other with respect like adults.
cons: Red tape everywhere.... for everything. Figuring out how to navigate it can be difficult. Most teams are matrix type with multiple managers and possibly remote management. Remote management can be either a pro OR a con depending on the manager ;)

pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay, quiet office
cons: The employees this role supports have quite the egos and are disrespectful. One employee mocked the Me Too movement in a staff meeting, and another employee looked me up and down, checking out my body in a very inappropriate way. Work-life balance isn't great, and expectations are unreasonable. They have bad manners and never say thank you

pros: In my light experience within LM I have been treated fairly, I feel like most work I do is valuable.  It also seems to be a good place to work, when a program gets cut, upper management really attempts to facilitate moving employees instead of laying them all off.
cons: The salaries are not as good as some of the private companies, but the job security is higher than private companies.  They also have downsized their masters reimbursement programs a bit.

review_title: Good place to launch a career
pros:
Good place to start a career
Tuition Reimbursement program good for young engineers.
Job security- more stable than commercial companies.
cons:
Work pace is slow sometimes due to the loads of paper work.
Not many opportunities to work with leading edge technology.
Pay is a little below the average market value.
Sometimes your reports to manager has no clue on your work assignments.

pros: Great pay, good benefits, good people, a lot of support, company has the best of intentions, wants to do the right thing, very ethical, very people oriented.
cons: Too much focus on pushing young people into management, creates a void of opportunities for middle age employees.  HR seems to have too much influence overall.

review_title: Wrong place if you are not a woman
pros: Decent benefits and retirement. Good variety of clients and business areas to work in. Good online training opportunities. Most employees really care about the client's mission.
cons: If you are a male, you are going to have a tough time in getting promoted.  Pay is low compared to the rest of industry.

pros: Engineering excellence is part of culture; breadth of opportunities in types of jobs and locations, extreme depth in technical fields, recognized as industry leader in many areas
cons: Aging workforce; huge company with associated bureaucracy; government customer often stifles innovation; LM subcontracts actual manufacturing of most products to other companies; extremely long product cycle in most areas (often 5-10 years); use of aging technologies (for Space programs)

review_title: Treatment of employees is horrible but pay and benefits are very good.
pros: Competitive pay and benefits.  9/80 work schedule.
cons: Some of the very senior level managers use fear and intimidation to manage.  I have seen some shockingly disrespectful things said to employees. Their next level group managers and employees are afraid to approach them or bring them bad news.  Not a good situation.  All of the managers here could use some serious training.

review_title: Working on a contract was unique.
pros: Big name company, looks great on the resume. Pays well if you aren't tied to a government controlled scale on a contract.
cons: Working on a contract for the goverment was more like working for a smaller company.  There was a big disconnect between the overall corporate culture and the local culture.

review_title: Could be worse, but could be much better.
pros: You get to see lots of really neat things going on at the plant. You also gain a lot of experience that is transferrable to other positions.
cons: The health plan leaves much to be desired. You gain experience because you are thrown into things you have no idea how to do and have to figure it out.

review_title: Staff Systems Engineer designing sonar, radar, air defense, and EW systems.
job_title: Staff Systems Engineer in Syracuse, NY
pros: Reasonable benefits, pay, and flex time.
cons:
Expect you to make up all appointments due to having flex time - it's like being an hourly worker.
Annual appraisals pit employee against employee.  Leads scape goat their team members, but management does not investigate.  Most emplyees seems unhappy at all sites I have dealt with.  Only 10-20% of emplyees win most awards and get raises above inflation (and yet they wonder why nobody goes into engineering anymore!).

pros: Very ethical work environment.  Very good job security.  The work we do is meaningful to the nation and the world.  The type of work envolves really cool sensor technology that isn't available anywhere else.
cons: Defense industry is very conservative in investment risk. Gov't customer requires low profit margin.  It's difficult to incentivize employees to grow the business.  Pay and promotions seem to stagnate.

review_title: Depends on the project and site
job_title: Embedded Software Engineer in Dallas, TX
pros: Culture varies greatly across sites, and even between projects. Good work life balance in most cases, relatively decent compensation, and the chance to work on some really interesting technology.
cons: You're either working on something cutting edge or maintaining something 30 years old, and there's a culture clash there. Some projects can turn into death marches due to inexperienced project management. Career advancement is not very meritocratic, consisting of either mandatory promotions after a few years, or politics.

review_title: Stay away from their contracted IT
pros: You only work monday- Friday. No weekend work
cons: You get stuck as a wage determined employee which means if the federal minimum wage doesn't increase, neither does your salary. They are only obligated to pay you the minimum wage so they take advantage of it. They don't care about employees but they always want you to make the company look good. They don't support you against the customer, you're always at fault no matter what. There's no room for growth. If you're a pc tech you can't advance unless you have a specialized degree

review_title: It's been a good place for me to develop
pros: Large network of mentors and coaches available to those who seek help. Many opportunities to those who seek to try new things, work at different locations, and expand the experience and technical base.
cons: Working as a government contractor means things often move slowly and there is plenty of bureaucracy.

job_title: Tier II Help Desk in Vienna, VA
pros: Nice co-workers and it's close to the Metro
cons: Pretty much everything! This contract services TSA, Lockheed under-bid the contract in the beginning, so don't expect great pay or any type of raises. Management is just trying to keep their heads above water on this contract. So, there are absolutely no perks and expect to be asked to make a financial "contribution" when it comes time for the company picnic and holiday party. It's very sad the way employees are treated on this contract. I can promise you, if you come to work here, you'll regret it.

review_title: Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company Valley Forge, PA
job_title: Electrical Engineer Associate in King of Prussia, PA
pros:
Ultra flexible work days
9-80 work week (get every other Friday off)
Lots of Time off (15 vacation, 10 holidays per year)
Employees go above and beyond for each other
cons:
Few contracts and future work seems to be 5+ years out before anything worth while rolls in. 

Company cares very little about employees and can go above and beyond to get rid of them. 

Not a very diverse workplace

Very little chance of real design work. Most of the job consisted of sustainment and engineering analysis

pros: State of the are work environment and projects.  Staff is very professional and knowledgeable in their individual fields.  They try very hard to promote from within.
cons:
Very slow in processing prospective employees in the interview process and very time consuming

Orientation process for people going there the first time for interviews should be eliminated.

pros: salary, technology, job security, career opportunities and opportunities to travel and transfer within the company, aspects of the job are very dependent on division and program- each is very different.
cons: The bureaucracy and politics can be a little bit much at times. Also, the plant that I worked at had gross cubicles and dirty office facilities but the manufacturing plant was very clean.

job_title: Quality Engineer Staff in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great Pay, very good benefits, awesome growth potential
cons: Not much, maybe management at times but that's mainly the proverbial bad apple you'll get anyplace. Non- management employees used to have to give 5 hours a week before overtime kicked in so that meant working 45 hours before you got paid for overtime basically gave a free 5 hours to the company.

review_title: Rewarding mission creates positive career opportunities.
pros: The mission is to bring people home everywhere, every time. This makes it rewarding and satisfying to support our daily objectives. There seems to be lots of new opportunities to collaborate across Lockheed and likely new career opportunities for those interested in other challenges.
cons: There has been a lot of transition after Sikorsky was acquired by Lockheed, but there has been good and positive communication throughout the year.

job_title: Senior Staff Software Engineer in Orlando, FL
pros: Cool technology. Beautiful campus. Good salaries.
