cons: Ridicuously metrics driven. Technology company where technical ability is not valued. Employees are not valued.  Manangement referrs to  talent as "resources".   The people doing the work that requires technical ability are the least valued.

job_title: Systems Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good contract status with gov.  Not going away.
cons: Silos abound, management plays safe and good at finding blame.  Strategy seems to be to ignore issues until promoted away from them.

pros:
Stable
Looks good on a resume
Large company
cons:
Clueless management
Communication, inter-department gossip is typically how you find out about upcoming changes or issues.
Lack of responsibility/ownership, don't be surprised if at the end of they year, you didn't achieve things you  had no idea where even a thing.   On the opposite end, those that over-promise and fail to meet promises are rewarded for "stretch" goals.

pros: If they have a contract and you are needed you might have a job until the budget is blown.
cons: When the contract is up or you are too expensive that is it. People are fired every week. They require LOTS of FREE overtime. They prefer a cheap new grad who works lots of overtime. The schedule means nothing. Most of the budget is blown by Managers. The tiny tiny part of the budget is given to the unimportant tasks done by Engineers.

pros:
Worked for LMT for 5 years and enjoyed most of the time there.  
Good management to employee communication.
Interesting work.
Decent salary.
cons:
Employee to management communication channels could be better.  
Massive chain of command.  
Most immediate supervisor changed frequently.  
Move away from Matrix / Functional management leaves employee with potential problem finding next position when current project is completed.

pros: Diverse workset with diverse set of customers.  Flexibility to move from a small program activity to a large program.  Also flexiblity to move between organizations and sites nation wide.
cons: Government contracting in the defense industry tends to have budgets up and down.  Currently in a down swing and numerous layoffs have and will continue for the next year or so.

pros: friendly people make it good place to work.  great opportunities for gaining leadership experience and knowledge.  one can easily shift job focus and locations without too much hassle.
cons: one can get lost in the shuffle and feel more like a part of the machine rather than an individual if you aren't motivated and don't make a name for yourself.

review_title: Great place to work if you enjoy a slower pace of work.
pros: People are intelligent.  Good work life balance.  9/80 work schedule means three day weekends every other day.  A good number of younger employees.
cons: It's slow, which depending on what you want can be a Pro. That's probably just indicative of the aerospace industry as a whole.  Management is smart but not always the best at getting the most out of their employees.  Pay is average.

pros: it is big compnay with many business unit, if you know people then you could move around, company promotes diversity at work place but that is not applied to upper managemetn culture.
cons: Upper managment style; old white boys netwrk, no admin time between projects (as soon as porject ends, they lay you off)

pros: A big enough company that gives you the option to relocate.  Good management, benefits, time off, and education assistantce.
cons: Minimal pay raises, be sure to negotiate your salary as high as possible prior to starting with them as their pay raise structure is so computerized it gives the managers no flexibility.

review_title: Not bad if you know how to network
job_title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer in Syracuse, NY
pros: Compensation is good and overall a nice place to work.  But if you want to get anywhere or position yourself for a spot on a new project, you have to know the right people.
cons:
Management gets moved up based on who they know not what they know.
Medical benefits are now TERRIBLE.  I had to practically share the cost of a 3 night hospital stay with the insurance company (around $1500) which would normally have been fully covered under our old plan.

review_title: Engineering Specialist Senior - Propulsion controls on thrust vectoring aircraft
job_title: Engineering Specialist Senior in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Lockheed Martin went out of their way to take care of me when I had health problems
cons: Too big and it's a defense contractor relying on government money.  When Cheney canceled an aircraft program back in the 1980s, employment went from 33,000 to 17,000 over the holiday break.  LM was General Dynamics then and this cancellation devistated the company.

pros: Very secure position for an employee who doesn't look at porn on their work computer and refrains from discriminatory language or actions.
cons:
Incredibly high stress
Military environment poorly compatable with civilian employees
Multiple layers of management expecting direct reports from anyone below them
Poor understanding of bottle knecks, not just on the production facility, but within business functions
Customer demands do not reflect customer budget

job_title: IT Program Manager in Huntsville, AL
pros: Great Benefit package Health Dental and 401K
cons: Lockheed has grown too large to care for it's employees. There is no loyalty from management to the individuals who perform the work and keep them employed on a per contract basis.

pros: Lockheed Martin touts its integrity and as an employee, you can see it's not just for PR.
cons:
Despite promoting their "Full Spectrum Leadership" model, they don't actually elevate true full spectrum leaders.  Ever since Bob Stevens left, this company has struggled with promoting the right leaders and instilling confidence.

Also, in past years the flexibility and work life balance has eroded.

job_title: Field Service Technician in Laverton, Western Australia
pros: Full time job, medium job security, Defence related unlikely to be axed.
cons: Very low Base pay with long hours and constant shift work. Salary seems good at first but is really quite low at about $24/Hr or less. Pay rises are lower than CPI most years. Salary of about $90000 seems ok but is in actual fact well earned by mandatory and considerable overtime and long 12 Hr  shifts. Highly skilled and experienced Emplyees are earning little more than minimum Award wages for longer hours worked plus National Employment Standard (NES) mandatory allowances.

pros: Great work schedule and work life balance. During tough times, managers will try to find you a spot for you in order to keep you. Once you have a good manager who really trust and cares about your career, you can soar.
cons: Trust is a major issue for early and mid-career employees. You're only as good as the assignments you're given or that's available. You are still rated amongst those who have outstanding opportunities. Compensation is not competitive to the market.

pros: There is a lot of opportunity for variety if you are willing to jump around between contracts and have a clearance.
cons: There is not a lot of job security if your contract ends and you have not found another contract to work on. They would rather hire already cleared employees than take the time to clear their own.

review_title: Good company with tons of opportunities
job_title: Radar Systems Engineer in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Fully Flexible hours, lots of room for growth, good benefits. Stable job doing interesting work for the Navy. Very cool career opportunities for travel and testing in different places around the world.
cons: Some organizational inefficiencies. Big loss in translation between upper management and engineers. Disorganized decision making leads to nuisances on our end.

pros:
Fantastic opportunities for the driven
Ability to learn new skills
Believe in their mission statement and perform with excellence
When training is available, take it
Excellent senior mange meant and long range plans
cons:
Training budgets are constrained
Middle management believe in timelines for progression over ability which can hold top performers back

pros: Super smart, probably top 10% of country's talent work at this great company. They work hard, smart and produce one of a kind products.
cons: The only problem is the limited resources and the historical system that would be great to change to be more updated to the current standard of work environment. Young folks not staying there for very long!

pros: people are always impressed when you tell them you work for LM. they give decent PTO and 401k matching.
cons: huge wage disparity between different pay ledgers so people working in the same building are being compensating very differently for the same type of work on a different project. unwilling or unable to correct wrongs.

pros:
Good benefits and pay.
Great flexible working time and every other Friday off.
Additional programs to enrol on once employed although they are competitive.
cons:
Can easily get left behind.
If you manage to get on one of the development programs then you're looked after and your development is a high priority, if not then it's difficult to make an impression.

job_title: Software Manager in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: New UAV development and software components (Ground Control Station (GCS) applications, datalinks, airborne embedded code).
cons: Growing pains of integration of engines and UAV reliability. Need integration of software group into PM as an asset not a liability. Culture has changed from what it was before so its on the right track. Need to think of UAS as a system of systems.

pros: Off every other Friday, ability to work from home part of the week, occasional business travel, multi-year vacation accrual (up to set limit)
cons: Low salary for a software engineer job and hard to negotiate raises/benefits, a lot of unnecessary bureaucracy and policies that come with being an employee of a large company, non-flexible hours (even when telecommuting)

pros: Lockheed Martin has great benefits and lots of opportunity.  Lockheed has locations all over the country and world.  Also there are many different fields that can be explored.  Working at Lockheed you will have the opportunity to work on exciting issues and projects that in many cases really make a difference.
cons: No downsides to speak of.

review_title: Great at milking taxpayers out of money
job_title: Project Specialist Senior Staff in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Great salary and benefits and an absolute obsession with tracking every last minute of overtime. They have no problem with paying people to sit around and wait for something to do.
cons: Absolutely no strategy for how to compete unless it involves lobbying Congress for more handouts. Managers completely immobilized by trying to cover their assess once things inevitably go wrong.

review_title: It was a good place to work for the first few years, but not a place to be much after that
pros: they have great flex time. The ability to just leave when i hit 40 hours each week. The paid overtime after 40 hours (now 45 hours) isn't bad either
cons: the union keeps everyone basically at the same place. They don't reward individual achievement. Its not really a software place

pros: Great benefits, great telecommuting option if you have unclassified work, flexible work schedules.
cons: Work is boring, but that's a personal opinion.  I desire to do research and analysis and thought I'd be doing that here, but the Aeronautics company is largely a top level systems integrator, i.e. the subcontractors are the ones doing the scientific/research sort of work and LM puts it together.  I didn't get a science/engineering degree so that I could update technical documents!

pros: Lockheed Martin has talented and quality engineers.  You get to work on exciting and innovative projects.  There is a wide range of work across many work locations.
cons: Technology seems to always be ten years behind the times.  Too much of the leadership refuses to make risky decisions, and the primary customer is unwilling and incapable of accepting change.

review_title: Disjointed company, some areas are better than others.
pros: Lots of company discounts and networking and cross-training opportunities
cons: Benefits are not what they should be; feedback to management is discouraged

review_title: Can be a company that you spend a lifetime with...
job_title: Staff Engineer in San Jose, CA
pros: Competent engineering, competitive salary, good benefits (excellent 401k choices).  This is a company that generally keeps employees, potentially for decades, as long as the work is present and/or customers keep funding their jobs.
cons: No stock options, large amounts of process and documentation (unfortunately a part of the industry eg. aerospace/defense), management can be disconnected from engineering, if work is limited, job security drops dramatically

pros: Not a bad place to work. Decent pay. Ok benefits (not great). Culture is bureaucratic. Good place to start a career.
cons: Lower pay and benefits in services business. Training and development opportunities have become more limited with recent budget cuts and and cost savings initiatives.

pros: Got to work on advanced aircraft, classified systems and see some amazing things.
cons:
Many good people, but very political.  Slow to change.  
They are pushing down expectations and entire level.  So managers work is now being performed by supervisors at a supervisors pay rate.

review_title: Lockheed Martin provides challenging engineering and technology opportunities, both in USA and around the world.
job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Challenging tasks.  Worldwide travel.  Cutting edge technology.  Flexible work schedule.
cons: Advancement of unskilled engineering professionals to technical management.

pros: LM is a great company to work for. My manager was great and really helpful. I was trusted with assignments that actually challenged me.
cons: A lot of bureaucracy. I spent so much time doing nothing, because I needed some sort of authorization from somebody who was on vacation. Also I received a letter of intent from LM, went to an interview, and was told I would hear whether I got the job in two weeks. Its been a month since then and the stress is killing me.

review_title: Lockheed Martin has a very positive focus on ethics and full spectrum leadership.
pros: Significant focus on Ethics and effective leadership. Outstanding opportunities with technology and science, as seen from the vast products and services.
cons: Reductions in workforce have become more frequent, which often means competing for your own position. There has also been a significant change in leadership especially in the IT area.

pros: Management tries hard to do right by the employees, as long as it doesn't cost anything. Great place for junior and mid-range employees. The company is doing some really cool things. Good benefits. Competitive pay.(good, not great)
cons:
Giant aerospace company suffers at the whim of the government budgets. Practices age discrimination. Promotions are rare. Raises are hit and miss. If you happen to work for a bad manager your life will be miserable. Thankfully most managers are not bad.
Benefits get cut every year.

pros: Company environment is excellent, no complaints about the social environment. Very good benefits package in general. Liked the 401K match, Great medical and Dental. Benefits cant be beat with a quasi government position.
cons: Hours worked are excessive, overtime is not typically compensated. Would be nice if the hours worked were appreciated and management were capable of seeing and appreciating the hours.

pros:
Open office space for each team to enhance communication while working.
Friendly and knowledgeable people.
cons:
Teams are so segregated that they use different developer tools and methodologies to accomplish tasks. This results in conflict if two teams have to work on the same project.
This lack of consistency also means some teams have better training and coaching while other teams struggle from lack of experience in training.
Underwent growing pains as a company and had a lack of space,  desks, and equipment for new employees.

job_title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer in Marietta, GA
pros: Great opportunity for college students to get that first experience.  Great people and challenging work.
cons: No clear career advancement path.  "Fend-for-yourself" approach to career advancement.  You are ok if you stay at level 3 or below.  If you reach level 4, your job is constantly at risk until you reach level 6 or above.  Large gap between older population and younger engineers leaves a knowledge gap that severely needs to be filled.

job_title: Software Engineer Senior in Rockville, MD
pros:
Family like culture
Individuals dedicated to their work
Lots of work at home flexibility
Gratifying work
cons:
Government contracting in IT suffering a contracting forcing them to spinoff the IT services organization
Cutbacks on benefits, parties, etc have reduced dedication to company.
Too much work at home can be a bad thing for teams.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Flexible work schedule.  Flex 40 or Flex 9 80. Engaging work. Working along side many engineers and scientist with Masters and PHDs.  Work on systems that improve national security
cons: Lockheed Martin is a very big enterprise and it is easy to feel like a small piece.  There are many layers of management and procedure which it change slow.

review_title: It was an okay experience. Worked on fairly standard software tools and ran projects solo.
job_title: Software Engineer Associate in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
9x80 schedule was somewhat nice. 
We got some benefits through the company, but still weren't great.
cons:
Self starters are not always welcomed. 
Improve upon the benefits for employees. 
Perhaps take better care of the regular conveniences like snacks and coffee. They are fairly inexpensive and honestly make a big difference.

review_title: Large corporation, as always, comes with pro's and con's
pros: Options to move around, good salary range,  interesting hardware.
cons: Things can move very slowly, management isn't the greatest, most that are promoted into those roles are just on track to reach the next level.  Work satisfaction is very dependent on the business unit and location you're working in.

pros: At the Space Company, you have a chance of working on some interesting programs with some brilliant people. The pay is good. Decent work/life balance on unclassified programs.
cons: You're either contributing to death, destruction, and duress or subsidizing it. Fake corporate community & inclusion. Favoritism & poor management. Spiraling retention & morale problems on some programs.

review_title: Great if you want a stable, low stress job
job_title: Hardware Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Large, Stable company. 
Lots of opportunities to move around the company. 
Excellent benefits packages, including a great tuition reimbursement program for engineers.
Lots of resources available within the company for training and self education.
Impressive projects, especially within the Aeronautics unit (i.e. Joint Strike Fighter, F-22, etc)
cons:
Mediocre pay compared to other competitors or similar corporations.
Hard to move up rapidly within the organization.
Slow-paced, low stress work environment. (I knew a new hire who had no real work for several months)

pros: Lockheed Martin provides a lot of opportunity for professional development (training, classes, IRAD) and for professional advancement (same job, new project as well as new job, same project).
cons: This is a big organization and you can get 'lost' by being pigeonholed in a particular job.  Do your best and tell your management what development and advancement you want every chance you get.

review_title: Coworkers were great,but  management plays too much politics
job_title: Laboratory Logistics Engineer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Pay and benefits were good, great coworkers, work environment was very good. Very good worklife balance due to 9/80 workweek.
cons: Too much politics from management made getting things done properly very difficult. In many cases, management was poor and unqualified to lead engineers and scientists. Upward job progression was very difficult to accomplish due to the system in place

job_title: Senior Staff Systems Engineer in Herndon, VA
pros: Pension if you're grandfathered in. Good employee discounts program. Large company that's good at playing the Washington political game, so it has weathered the economic down-turn pretty well.
cons: Non-existent training budget. Healthcare too expensive. 401k match only 4%, and fund choices aren't that great. Too large to really get noticed. Poor management connection with the average worker. Employee performance rating system is poor.

review_title: Positive, leadership is engaged and care about their employees' professional growth.
pros: LM is a good place to work because of the diverse portfolio of opportunities that you have to contribute and grow as both a invividual contributor and leader.
cons: This is a large company where you can get overlooked if you do not work your network of mentors and business partners.

job_title: Electronics Technician in Cannon AFB, NM
pros: Lockheed Martin is a great company to work for overall, the benefits are great and the technology is astounding.
cons: Management. At least at the current branch that I work for.  There is no work life balance at this branch and my supervisor is very sexist. If you want a vacation you might as well forget about it. If you want to advance at this branch, unless you are a part of the "good ol' boy" club, forget about it.

pros: This is a old boy company where they like the old way of doing things, but on the other hand love to work with all the smart people. Foster growth, life and work balance is great.
cons: Too much politics especially where the government get their hands in some of the budget planning process.

pros: There are good people that work there.
cons: The threat of being laid-off hangs over everyone's head, the company hardly forces anyone with 30+ years to retire leaving those with barely a few years there with WARN notices.  Lockheed is definately a "Good Ole Boys" network.  VPs sponsors those to promote on the fast track when it's not WHAT you know, it's WHO you know.

pros: There is a culture of diversity, ethics, inclusion and opportunity. There are some decent benefits. Opportunity to work on some very exciting programs.
cons: Salaries are not the highest compared to other similar companies. Too focused on younger employees, leaving older employees feeling unappreciated and uncertain about their jobs. More advancement for the younger employees than the older employees. Micro-management.

review_title: Lockheed was the best place I worked.  I enjoyed every aspect and minute of my job.  I truly miss working at Lockheed.
job_title: Senior Call Center Analyst in Baltimore, MD
pros: Teamwork, support within the department, understanding when just starting and management and colleagues always taking time to assist you and customers when needed.
cons: None that I can think of at this time.

pros: Excellent Performance is rewarded with monetary awards and pay increases.  The culture is centered around ethics, accountability, and building partnerships.
cons: The senior leadership can be reactionary and respond in fear to risks.  This type of response is counter productive and provided little in the way of leadership.

review_title: Ridiculously easy work for more money than is reasonable in the area.
job_title: Electronics Technician in Kings Bay, GA
pros: Good Pay, Frequent Raises, Good Benefits, Easy Work, No Pressure, Union, Upper Management.
cons: Being forced to stay over based on seniority with the union, agonizingly slow and inefficient process, no one wants to improve the process because "It's always been that way", Lower management only cares about appeasing their superiors and not taking care of their employees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grand Prairie, TX
pros: Great oportunities for movement once you get it. Great benefits package. Lots of room for growth if you are younger as the baby boomers retire. Stand up desks!
cons: Depressing atmosphere and culture. Big age gap. Everything takes way longer than it should. Minimal support for new ideas and implementing chsnge.

job_title: Software Engineer, Senior in Orlando, FL
pros: Established company to work for. Decent pay and benefits. Many locations around the U.S. Paycheck every Friday. Many (conformist) employees will get to keep their jobs for a long time.
cons: Still using antiquated technology and tools. After working for the company for almost 10 years, there is no clear path to career advancement. New hires directly from college have many more opportunities. People with over eight years with the company are totally forgotten. Training is almost non-existent.

job_title: Financial Analyst in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Flexible work hours, allows telecommuting, where applicable. Coworkers are great, work is steady most times.  Normal benefits for maternity leave, but workplace accommodates nursing moms with a designated space to pump.
cons: As a part of a functionally matrixed org, it means you may have several managers to report to and a fairly complex mandatory 360 review cycle that rarely equates to what you get for your yearly raises.

review_title: Working on the most interesting mission problems
pros: You can work on the most interesting problems in the world and some of the most intelligent, patriotic people in our nation. From the future manned space craft program to the most sophisticated cybersecurity systems, you can get exposure to unimaginable capabilities.
cons: Always at the mercy of the Government. Slow to change monolithic, mega programs. Embraces change, but customers typically aren't ready.

job_title: Configuration Analyst in Kings Bay, GA
pros: The team environment, the time off, and the FLEX 9x80 schedule are really the perks of working here. Pay is also decent for the area.
cons: The biggest con is the ability to move into higher grade jobs within a time-frame less than 5 years, no matter what experience prior to working for this company,

review_title: 24 years Excellence Award / Brain Stroke / Fired
job_title: Information Assurance Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Plenty of opportunities through-out the company.  Started working for the company in 1988 (Then General Dynamics).
cons: One year I was given the Company;s Excellence Award.  The following year I had a brain stroke at work.  Came back to work after recovery.  Then told that my performance was lack.  Given fewer and fewer assignment.  Complained about me performance eval and then less than 3 month my employment was terminated.

pros: This used to be a great company, it had career paths for the movers and shakers and the leadership had a great deal of integrity.
cons: Recent changes in leadership had created a very high-school like environment, where friends are promoted, and hard work is not rewarded.

pros: Process Oriented, decent pay, benefits are ok, Great locations, lots of opportunity to do different things within the company.
cons: Acquisition companies get the run around, top heavy, not agile enough, not good for mid to experienced careers. Lots of drive to get rid of long time employees to get younger, new people in at less money.

pros: You really can't beat the pay. This is one corporation that really takes care of it's employees and takes all concerns seriously. I had a minor injury on the job and was taken excellent care of, put in physical therapy (on company time!) Just a great company to work for. Always opportunity for growth.
cons: Can't really think of a single complaint.

review_title: A Once Proud Company Now Destroyed
pros: Decent pay but that is about it. Can't really think of anything else good to say about it.
cons: The Aeronautics division in Marietta has become a cesspool over the past several years. No one seems to know what their jobs are and management does not have a clue what is going on. New people are being brought in without the proper backgrounds for the work and the existing workforce is counting the days until they can retire or leave.

pros:
Great benefits
Decent Salary Raises / with Yearly Reviews
Huge company - huge opportunities
(ISGS division - recently merged with Leidos - yet to be seen if this is pro or con) but should work out OK for both
cons:
Because its a huge company - you must be persistent and pro-active to move up.
Often times, some managers will try and keep their employees where they are.

review_title: Very demanding and fast paced, but rewarding.
pros: Top company in their industry. Lots of opportunities to be a part of high profile projects.  Supportive of additional training and education.
cons: Pay is often below national average for mid to low level employees, but above for management. Very process heavy environment, which can bog down results.

job_title: Data Warehouse Analyst in Fort Worth, TX
pros: I’ve gone from dreading to going to work to looking forward to it. Working at Lockheed Martin introduces you to so many new talents and technicalities that will benefit you for a lifetime; wherever you go.
cons: Work culture is outdated. Corporate and noncorporate are distant. System is set up  for folks to move upwards slowly. As businesses continue to evolve. It is wise to encourage all ideas to those who can make things happen

pros: Good benefits. Good compensation. Room to grow. Start your career here. But buy no means stay here.
cons: Unwilling to embrace new technology. This is not a technology company. This is a manufacturing company that sometimes uses technology. Begrudgingly.

review_title: One of the best Aerospace companies
pros: The company is established, so it offers great job security. They do a great job trying to make sure employees as satisfied and that employees are in a position that they want to be in.
cons: The obvious cons are that they have a difficult time competing with many of the "attractive" silicon valley firms in terms of benefits, and workplace environment. It's a combination of experienced engineers and younger "millennial" engineers. Thus, the workplace is a very corporate environment

review_title: Good, but could be a lot better.
job_title: Aircraft Maintenance Support Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Many of the workers. I believe very safe employment environment as far a job security. As all government contractors, lay-offs do happen.
cons: Good ole boy system. Inconsistent discipline system. Ethics is non-existent. Benefits continue to deteriorate. Promotions only come majority of the time if you change positions.

review_title: A good stable place to stay
job_title: Associate Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
-Can transfer between departments relatively easily
-Is a secure job - usually is hard to get laid off in this position (they need coders)
-Benefit from experienced colleagues who has worked on various systems for years (if not decades) to help mentor you
cons:
-Depending on where you land up, the technology used may not be the most recent
-Lots of legacy code if not working on a new project
-Lots of bureaucracy (twice as much since both working with US government and also with a large coorperation)

pros: Large company with growth opportunities.
cons: Working as a contractor when you may not be taken care of at the end of the contract.  Additionally, the benefits package is really bad.  You would think that with 100K employees that we would have an awesome medical package, but instead I pay $500 per month for medical/dental benefits.  I paid $225.00 per month prior to working for Lockheed Martin.

review_title: Interned at LM, good experience, better resume
pros: Was offered a full time job following internship with competitive salary/ full benefits (still yet to accept), helpful coworkers, manager always available (when not in meetings). Having an internship doing meaningful work at a major company looks good on your resume apparently.
cons: Cubicle land- love it or hate it. Work can be tedious/boring at times. May be forced to work overtime, but not be payed for it

pros: A large company with many opportunities. Current employees have the ability to apply for jobs all over the country and the world. Current employees are given preference for jobs over outside applicants.
cons: Employee evaluations are not easy. LM has tried many methods of evaluating emloyees; and still have not seemed to "get it right".  The cap on the number and types of ratings seems unfair.

review_title: If you have anything going for you....chances are you will leave Lockheed Martin
pros: Stress free job, 40 hours a week at the max, goo starting salary, good health insurance, ERP system is pretty easy to learn.
cons: Bureaucratic, no merit raises, doesn't groom talent, I feel like they are out to get me.

pros: Great place to work if you're risk averse.  Awesome benefits and family oriented company that, to the best of its ability stresses work life balance.
cons: Many in management that are entrenched, few management opportunities for your talent.  Despite the acknowledgement of quality work, emolyees are expected to "get in line" behind less talented coworkers with more tenure.

review_title: I enjoy my tenure at Lockheed Martin
pros: LM is a huge company that provides you with many avenues that you can pursue over your career.  It also can provide you with travel, and meaningful skills that can be transfered to other jobs.
cons: Some aspects still seem pretty political or alternate motive.  Some management have large egos and feel the need to try and flew their "muscle".

review_title: Good place to start your career
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Springfield, VA
pros: Good place to start your career... big company with well defined policies make it easy for new employees.  Rewarding work, not that stressful (unless you choose to take on additional responsibilities).  Fairly good work / life balance (flex time, etc).
cons: Its a big company with a lot of Process.  The process frequently gets in the way of getting work done, which can be frustrating at times if you are a 'result oriented' person

review_title: It looks glamorous from the outside but its not.
pros: Above average salaries, good benefits, large company so your ability to move within the company once you are hired is quite easy compared to trying to get in from the outside.
cons: The locations are not glamorous, office politics take a toll after awhile, management that have been there for many years play favorites, upward movement within some offices are challenging.

review_title: Hard place to work, but you feel like you did something at the end of the day.
pros: You are involved in cutting edge work and you are working with some of the best and brightest  people around.
cons: Large number of people so harder to get acknowledged for your work. Seem like much of what you do only gets seen by the people around you.

review_title: Good for people that want to be part of the corporate structure.
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Liverpool, NY
pros: Decent benefits.  Stability when the economy is good.  Some programs have real cutting edge technology.  Well known company.  Many locations and divisions across the world.
cons: Very large company.  Hard to succeed if you don't want to be part of the management track. The defense industry can be unstable depending on the economy.

review_title: Conservative but well managed company with good benefits
job_title: Subcontract Administrator, Senior in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Flexible schedules, good benefits, many job opportunities, ethical company, great onsite gym program for workouts and health/fitness, a pension program  (no longer available to new hires or rehires though)
cons: Slow decision making process, few monetary rewards outside of salary and benefits, few developmental opportunities for mid level professional, conservative culture, government budget cuts always looming.

review_title: Great company to work for, but at the mercy of Congress's ability to pass a budget...
pros: Great projects, great people, good company culture
cons: Military budget is at the mercy of Congress. If they cut the budget, the military budget goes down, which means program budget goes down, which means workforce reductions are constantly looming around the corner in today's economic instability.

pros: Excellent leadership development programs, amazing products and services, great benefits, numerous locations around the globe with flexibility for transfers typically, wide variety of functions available to work within
cons: Cyclical business, stove piped functions, growth opportunities diminishing, lack of forward thinking policies, practices, etc., work life balance difficult to manage for long periods of time, sometimes difficult to find inspiring leadership to model a career after

review_title: The Place To Be For Those With Pensions
job_title: Computer Systems Analyst in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
Excellent work/life balance benefits such as telecommuting
A great place for middle aged employees that are just looking to cruise through the remainder of the careers and cash in on their pension
cons:
Extremely limited career advancement opportunities
Pay scale is on the low end of the industry
Limited opportunities for advancement and little reason for those without a pension to stay

review_title: Good place for a long term career
pros:
Career Development
Many locations across the globe
Virtual work
Salary
Greater focus on health and wellness, (clinics at many of our facilities)
cons: EXTREMELY slow moving, risk averse, conservative working environment.  Recently cut benefits options down to only one and they keep hiking up the cost to the employee every year so whatever raise you do get basically gets absorbed by the rising costs of benefits.

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: There are so many areas to explore in the company since it has so many divisions.  You can take a stretch job assignment to try out a new area to see if its a good fit.
cons: Getting a good promotion is very hard since the company isn't growing.  So the only way to get ahead is to interview and get a new position

review_title: Great company to start a career
job_title: Staff Systems Engineer in Dallas, TX
pros: Strong emphasis on ethics, doing what is right, and respecting all employees regardless of rank creates an easy workplace environment to work in.
cons: Limited opportunities for career change/advancement or even work on new projects.  Despite being a large company, it is easy to get pigeon-holed into a job/organization.   Compensation is seniority based and not necessarily performance based (as most large companies).   Bureaucracy of large organization can drive you nuts sometimes.

review_title: The first 15 years they were people oriented but slowly degraded as they reduced employee incentives over next 15 years
pros: Excellent products, employees and customers to work with. Opportunity to advance education and experience.
cons: Reduced retirement and benefits give new employee no incentive to excel,

pros: High technology, excellent reputation in the industry. Committed to providing excellent products. Full benefits.
cons: Opportunities for useful training are non-existent; if you don't want to become a technical dinosaur, be prepared to get training on your own time and on your on dime. Raises are slim, and layoffs are getting more and more frequent. Work is cyclical due to defense spending. Meanwhile, the company is reporting record profits.

pros: $$$, but you have to sell your soul for it.  Consistently profitable because maximizing profit,  while maintaining reputation is the goal, even if it adversely affects employees.
cons: Top down management, where you are told what to do, when to do it, and where there is only one way to do it., Free thinking discouraged. Individual's input into the things and process that affect their jobs is discouraged rather then valued.

review_title: A great company that offered challenging job opportunities.
job_title: Operations Director in Las Cruces, NM
pros: The company gives people the opportunity to advance in their skill area.  I was promoted to positions of great responsibility over my 20 year career.  My managers were always supportive of my needs.
cons: It is tough to break into top level management positions.  Promotion can be difficult for many employees although not necessarily for me personally.

pros:
Locations all over the world
Contracts with practically every government agency
Strong demand for engineers
cons:
Mediocre benefits
Limited job growth
Horrible performance review process
Minimal raises if you're lucky

review_title: Started out great but went downhill
pros: Flexible work schedules, paid overtime, good benefits
cons: No promotions after a few years, no opportunities to climb the leadership/management ladder due to no new programs coming in.  All there is to do is keep working in the programs that have been around for many years.  Not really any new/exciting work to do.

job_title: Embedded Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Cool products, excellent flexibility and work/life balance. Good people to work with.
cons: Salary not great for software engineers. Because of the excess of 40-50 year old engineers, it is very hard for a young, high-achieving engineer to advance. Because of government customer, lots of red tape and paperwork. Cumbersome engineering processes.

review_title: Great Company, but easy to get lost in....
job_title: Staff Finance Analyst in Moorestown, NJ
pros: Great company to work for, decent pay and benefits.  Large organized corporate culture, forward thinking and diverse.  Some incredibly bright people work here and depending on the mix you are in it can be very exciting to be a part of the action.
cons: Very lean due to sequestration.  Layoffs abound and the future is uncertain at many sites.  Politics are unavoidable and budget cuts have put a dark cloud over the place.

job_title: Aircraft Mechanic in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good Pay and Benefits, and Overall Relaxed work environment.
cons: Lay-offs, adversary attitude between union and company. hard to advance with in the company based on experience, only quality desired is a degree from university.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Busy office. Days filled and go by fast. Nice coworkers most of the time. Team spirit.
cons: Some executives are unrealistic about job expectations and what can be accomplished by one admin. Being stretched too thin by having to support too many execs at the same time. Also because of upper mgmt/company changes morale is real low. Employees feel that any day they could be laid off.

review_title: Government customer pits company against employees
pros:
Good benefits and fair pay.
Great people at many sites.
Some sites are willing to adapt the latest technology, but many are not.
cons:
Poor customers.
Big drive to make cheap products + unwillingness to fight customer requirements = bad products.
Company bureaucracy can make change hard.
Managers are powerless to fix compensation issues.

pros: Overall great company to be a part of. Even though they are a very large company, they care about you individually and there is a lot of room to grow.
cons: The smaller offices often get overlooked. The security is very intense and makes simple tasks take way longer than necessary. This is especially true in the smaller offices where the security is not as important.

pros: Big company with many resources available to employees. Offers education assistance, which is great if you're looking to pursue higher education.
cons: It's a government contractor, so your job security depends on politics,  and you may not have control over maintaining your position regardless of how well you do.

pros: The work is what you make of it. You can be a regular 9-5'er or you can dig in and make something of yourself. Lots of opportunity to move around within the divisions. Great education opportunities, not as good as it used to be but still something.
cons: You can get lost in the crowd if you don't apply yourself. Upper management disorganization due to turnover tends to happen on a few programs

pros:
Flexible hours at my location.
Always able to take on as many challenges as you can handle.
Working for the defense of our nation and lifestyle.
cons: Large company so HR is always trying to get you in at the lowest price possible and then restrictive on pay raise amounts. Standard annual raise for good performance 3%. For stellar performance maybe 5%.

pros: Great company and culture. Passionate about the work I'm doing and performance based contracts is a good way to motivate people for higher performance. You can really see who is putting in the work.
cons: Hard to be promoted from within. Likely need to leave company and come back to be promoted to more of a management position. Benefits are alright, nothing to write home about. Pay is on the lower side I think for a large and recognized company.

job_title: Subcontract Administrator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: We make the best fighter jets in the world!
cons: Getting promoted takes FOREVER! Not a place for self-driven people who want to get ahead.

pros:
Very stable employment. You have great job security. It's close to impossible to get fired.
Good work/life balance. You only work 40 hours per week every week.
cons:
The good job security makes a lot of people realize they can do nothing and never get fired. Very hard to stay motivated in that kind of culture.

Compensation is heavily below market average.

job_title: Field Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: Experience can vary with each business unit, but I’ve enjoyed my time with RMS. Management is effective, but not intrusive. Try to manage as best of a work life balance as best as possible with travel.
cons: Pay raises are minimal at best. Health care is expensive, and not very good. Overtime gate waiver and approval is tedious.

pros: Big company with good benefits.  The comany also has a comittment to diversity.  Not just racial diversity but sexual orientation, nationality, age, etc.  It's a place where anyone can work and not feel like an outsider.  It has a very inclusive atmosphere.  There are also many company groups available for support.
cons: Just like anywhere, there is nepotism and a rumor mill.

review_title: Depends on the contract. Overall fairly positive experience.
pros: At Lockheed Martin (at least the contract I was on) you'll get a decent salary, consistant (but small) raises, a security clearance,  and a very good work/life balance.
cons: Staying at Lockheed for too long would only make you really valuable to other large defense contractors.

review_title: good place - employment outlook at PA site variable and unreliable
pros:
good benefits
nice location
depth of knowledge from legacy company employees
cons:
no corporate support to maintain level of work at this site
long term downward trend leading to the conclusion that eventually closing this site is the overall goal.

pros:
Standard 9-5 job without an aggressive work environment.
Many lifers at this company without much talent
Many job opportunities in different cities within the USA
cons:
Poor salary
Poor room for growth salary wise
No stock options given
The pension enrollment used to be automatic, but recently requires 2 year buy-in

review_title: Wish I joined LM 10 years sooner!
pros: Great corporate culture, focus is truly on the warfighter's needs.  9x80 work schedule with every other Fri off.
cons: Bureaucracy at senior levels can be very, very slow moving to get things done.  Proposals are Powerpointed to death, often with no one leaving the room making an actionable decision to execute the plan.

review_title: Great company, but like anything else, depends on your manager
pros: Industry leader in defense. Top quality products to support the warfighter.
cons:
For upward growth, you have to be willing to relocate.  As a former manger, I was forced by senior management to rate my employees into a bell curve with 90% as Satisfactory employees even though they deserved better ratings. 
Benefits are not as good, or cheap as you'd expect from a large company.

review_title: Great place to start a career
job_title: Software Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Opportunities to work on incredible products, great benefits coverage, and continues to offer education assistance. The company also has many programs to accelerate early/middle career employees into leadership roles.
cons: Workplace culture varies from business unit to business unit. Where change is needed, it's a steep uphill battle to change it.

review_title: Many good years spent working for Lockheed Martin
pros: Lockheed Martin does offer competitive benefits and good compensation, and overall has some good management and does reward good performance.
cons: Lockheed Martin decided to close our operations and moved the work and our jobs to other Lockheed Martin sites, which was not well received nor understood by our customers.  There are far too many layers of management.

pros: Good work/life balance, the gym is fantastic, interesting work if you can get by all the paperwork and procedures to do anything.  Ok pay, healthcare plan is just average, $1K deductible.
cons: Pension replacement plan is a joke, no opportunity for promotion, so much red tape it's difficult to actually do any real work.

job_title: Project Engineer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Every other friday off. Which is only at some lockheed locations. It depends on what business unit you're in.
cons:
Bureaucratic. Stuck in the 80's. No windows.

I will say it is dependent on your location and business unit. This company is too big to trust one review written. Every business unit has it's own culture and almost functions as a different company.

review_title: The best and the brightest Engineers in the A&D Industry are at Lockheed Martin!
pros: There is nothing this company can't do.  You truly work with the pinnacle of Engineering talent and the feats that we accomplish are incredible.  If it's cutting edge technology, we do it here.
cons: Work/Life balance is VERY poor.  Long hours with small 3% per year raises.

review_title: Spent nearly 20 years working here then company announced closure of facility
pros: Big company, lots of opportunity, work-life balance is outstanding, management where I worked was decent and most of them cared.
cons: You're loyal to the company but the company is only loyal to the bottom line.

pros:
Worked here for 8 years and really enjoyed it. As long as you're the kind of person who's happy to take up opportunities when they come along you can go a really long way.
The projects and programmes are all really interesting as well.
Money is reasonable to high, and benefits are above average.
cons: Promotion process is very long-winded and very competitive.

review_title: I thoroughly enjoyed working for Lockheed Martin
pros: Working for Lockheed provided me opportunities for growth both professionally and personally. The atmosphere was positive. It felt like more than just a job. You worked with cutting edge technology and were valued as part of a team.
cons: A down side is your job position can be impacted by contract awards. One minute the funding can be there for some time and then the next minute there is no longer any funding for the project you are working on.

pros: This is a very good place to work. You do not get micromanaged and the pay is pretty good. Love the 9/80 schedule!!!
cons: having to be at work at 7 am was a real drag and I was not a huge fan of Aramark in the cafeteria.

pros: I really enjoyed my time at Lockheed.  The company really seemed to care about it's employees and the work that they did.
cons: A lot of the work is government work which is not always good.  It means that you are dependent on the contract being renewed which does not always happen.

review_title: Overall, great company to work for!
job_title: Operations Engineering Manager in Orlando, FL
pros: Interesting work with opportunity to move around to gain a wide breadth of experience.
cons: Mainly defense oriented work that can be volatile. Job security usually not a high risk factor, but when there are layoffs, they are usually sudden and steep.

pros: Great company and people. 9/80 work schedule was great. Most management is appreciative and treats employees well.  Typical benefits in today's society. For admin stafff really no room for growth.
cons: With management there  is always a bad apple or two in the bunch. Employees with distance travel or small child care concerns have a hard time with the 9/80 schedule. Admin staff is now in pool and has management staff that really doesn't see what you do in a day to day basis.

review_title: Good Career Opportunities are moving Eastward
pros:
LM provides good basic benefits.  
Salary is comparable for the industry.
Health care options are good thought not great.
Matching Savings plan is good 
Good communication from management on company direction
cons:
Pension plan was discontinued.
Education on retirement plans and benefits was limited.

review_title: Not at fault for shaky industry, but
pros: Respected company, great coworkers, good PTO.
cons:
Little to no upward mobility.
Lack of substantial raises.
Poor communication between upper management and everyone else.

pros: It is a very steady job with almost no risk of being laid off or fired.  You could get away with working only 40 hours a week with no repercussions.
cons: Working in a union environment is very frustrating.  Even the salaried (non-union) careers feel like everything has to be too fair because it is such a big corporation.  There is no separation of employees who work harder than others.

pros:
-Good for folks starting out in the workplace out of college
-We were paid on a weekly basis 
-Telework culture was great
-Some of the managers really care about the people they manage
cons:
-My division (IS & GS) is being sold, so there was turnover when that was announced
-Low salary increases after good reviews
-Although tuition assistance is offered, it seems only certain divisions can take advantage of it (like the engineers), if you don't fall into the "business model"-- good luck trying to get the money offered.

review_title: Three years in, not too bad
pros: Challenging projects, chance to work on some of the most advance tech in the country with real word consequences of your work, lots of great folks with very in depth field experience
cons: Lots of old boys management, politics can be hit or miss depending on group/area, "that's the way we've always done it!" mentality

pros: Friendly co workers,  interesting things to work on, good benefits, competitive salary, flexible work schedule, employee engagement, employee recognition and awards
cons: Company is stingy with resources, difficult to get funds to do the work that is really necessary, higher management has very little visibility into what the general employee population needs on a day to day basis

job_title: Program/Project Management in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Stable long term employment.  Excellent benefits package.  Multiple locations with any opportunity someone could want job wise.
cons: Bogus career advancement opportunities except for the few.  Oppressive environment to work in despite years of surveys.  Slow and in-nimble in an era that values quick reaction capability.  Work life balance is a slogan not reality.

review_title: Your just an employee number. I am ready to move on.
pros:
-The pay (only good because of the Union)
-PTO
-Pays the bills
cons:
-The whole "diversity" thing they think got going is false.
-Super top heavy with management. Hierarchy is a spider web, and you'll never know your bosses boss because he/she doesn't know either. Riddle me that.
-Health Plan is horrible as like every health plan I've known.
-Very discriminating environment. They make their affirmative action quota and call it "diversity," don't believe me look at their Hierarchy.
-They rip off the government.
-You have to brown nose to move up.

pros: Great team of professionals working together with few bad apples.  If you like to be a professional and shine with others of similar type, this is the place.
cons: Management was "lax" due to good reviews from the customer, and failed to recognize creeping mediocrity until it was too late and the customer replaced them.

review_title: Decent company, but not helpful to individuals
job_title: Software Engineer Asc in Dahlgren, VA
pros:
-(Formerly) solid benefits including health insurance.
-Flexible work schedule (9/80).
-Plenty of events and forums, unless you're off-site (as I was)
cons:
-Very low entry-level pay
-Recruiter ignored me for weeks while other offers expired, refused to actually talk with me so we could negotiate
-Off-site personnel feel isolated. All the negatives of a large company without any of the support, policy enforcement, etc. that make large companies desirable.

pros: Overall a great place to work for. Some pros include relaxed pace of work, response management team, paths available for career advancement.
cons: There are very few cons in my opinion. Pay is a bit lower than other companies, work is perhaps a bit too slow at times.

pros: We do cool stuff. We have great leadership at all levels. Lockeed places great emphasis on engaging employees, giving back to employees and our communities. The benefits are some of the best I've seen and I've worked in several industries before starting here. Lots of mentorship programs and training available.
cons: You'd have to be very picky to think of any meaningful con. It just doesn't exist in my opinion.

pros: Great benefits.  Pay scales appear to a bit higher than smaller companies with similar jobs.  You always know what management's expectations are.  Low turnover rates.
cons: Advancement opportunities are more prevalant if you are willing to relocate.  Max of 4 weeks vacation, and you have to work 20 years to earn that.

pros: Good place to be when there is money to be made for corporate. Benefits are perhaps above average. I like the flex time which enables me to have a four day work week.
cons: No real salary increase for the past several years. You are part of company until the bottom line needs to be raised then you are just fodder.

pros: It is a big company so there is a lot of knowledge to go around, but like any other big company you get lost in the crowd.
cons: Career advancement is based on how long you have been in the company. Unless you want to suck up to people and devote your entire life to this company, don't expect any special recognition.

review_title: They don't seem to care about the workers in the trenches.
pros: Good benefits & opportunities for professional growth.  Large company with many locations provides job transfer if desired.
cons: Defense industry can be fickle so job security is risky.  Size of company makes any suggestions to change or improve processes nearly impossible.  Method of employee ratings causes competition among team members.

review_title: Great company to work for, but it takes a long time to accomplish anything
pros: Experience, name recognition, career growth.
cons: It takes too long to accomplish tasks (6 months to land an interview, taking months to pick individuals for layoffs, etc.)

review_title: Interesting mix of stress analysis to project management.
pros: Ability to take internal engineering classes as well as classes towards a masters or phd on the company dime. Great coworkers
cons: Layoffs, layoffs, layoffs. Other than that things are great. Greenville is not the nicest Lockheed location, but there are many opportunities to transfer within the company.

review_title: Lockheed Martin is a promising corporation to be employed
job_title: Senior Subcontracts Administrator in Manassas, VA
pros: The company is cognizant of the human element in its operations and is working to develop a culture that is best in class.
cons: It is a large and old corporation. Progress too often is stifled by those who are set in their ways and have accomodated systemic inefficiencies.

review_title: Truly enjoyed working for this company.
job_title: Business Analyst in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I was a retiring military member at the time I joined the company and they know how to take care of their people!
cons: There are not many negitives to this company.  I workd for them for three years before my contract ended and they did an excellent job assisting eith the transition.

review_title: Defense contracting, typical headaches, disconnected management
pros: Loved my job as a technical instructor for the Army.  Decent compensation package, decent pay. outstanding market penatration in defense sector. Works with smaller companies to partner on contract submissions.
cons: First line manager was outstanding, however those above him were out of touch, disconnected, and seemingly uncaring as to challenges employees face.  Human Resources performed poorly supporting employees.  law suit phobic..... opened several investigations based upon complaints submitted by disgruntled employees.  HR badgered employees to discredit management.

pros: there is lots of room for advancement in the company, as there's lots of turnover and 're-orgs' constantly. for the most part, the people who work there are nice and mostly get along
cons: unless you're a top performer, the pay can be lower than industry averages. they stick to corporate policies to determine salary instead of looking at employees individually. teams are segregated, and do not work well together all of the time (lots of finger pointing back and forth)
